This position will require you to promote the brand, service, and product to the associated audiences on social media. Your goal will be to create a new following for market and brand awareness, for which you will need to have the strategic sense required to build or optimize social media strategy. data and sentiment metrics to create a better understanding of the target audience and other stakeholdersExtract insights and make data-driven recommendations Stay ahead of the curve by keeping up with the latest social media trends, emerging platforms, and best practicesCreativeWrite long- and short-form social media messages that attract new users and engage current usersKeep social media platforms up to date with high-quality content assets that elevate our social media presenceAssess new platforms to reach a broader marketDevelop and launch organic and paid campaigns to build PSW’s following and engagementTechnicalLeverage social media marketing tools such as Buffer, HubSpot or Hootsuite for scheduling, monitoring, listening and analysisUse Canva or Adobe Creative Suite to create static and animated visual assets for social mediaGeneralCollaborate and coordinate with internal teams to ensure promotion of all PSW-related products, modules, and other updates or events.Other relevant tasks assigned by the Communication ManagerQualifications, Experience & Technical Competencies: Bachelors in Communications, Marketing, Business, New Media, or Public customer oriented with good multitasking and organizational abilityExcellent communication skills in English (level C1 and above), and Urdu, with the ability to communicate effectivelyExcellent Title: Student Recruitment Officer
Description: World Gates looking for a highly motivated, organized, dynamic and self-starting Student Recruitment Officer and immigration case file manager with a focus on delivering quality results. The successful candidates will play a primary role in helping to promote World-Gates’s school partners, recruit International students, and generate leads for visa services for Pakistanis who are interested in visiting or immigrating to CanadMain Duties and Responsibilities:Develop, implement and improve admission strategies;Attending in-person fairs and other events to promote college programs;Planning and participating in remote and on-campus events such as Virtual Fairs, Open Houses and Information Sessions;Visiting student recruitment agencies, offering training and information sessions about new programs and services;Responding to email, telephone, social media, and walk-in inquiries from potential students;Promoting curriculum and services in an honest, accurate, and ethical manner;Establishing and maintaining monthly targetstracking and reporting on weekly activities (i.e. leads, appointments, meetings, applications, enrollment);Talking with potential students to explore their academic and career background, identify their career goals,Review and enhance current web presence and social media recruitment strategies, recommending and implementing new strategies as required;Evaluate and process admission applications;Update and maintain student admission profiles;Administer all marketing initiatives available online, in social media, and on print;Manage admission policies in accordance with provincial standards, regulatory bodies and accrediting agencies;Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in education, or marketing, advertising and / or business. 3-5 years experience in student recruitment and marketing, or immigration services. Managing digital marketing campaigns: Plan and execute online advertising campaigns, including search engine marketing (SEM), search engine optimization (SEO), social media marketing, email marketing, and content marketing, to enhance brand visibility and generate leads. Manage social media accounts, create engaging content, schedule posts, monitor performance metrics, respond to customer inquiries or comments, and grow the social media presence of the company in Pakistan. Content creation: Develop compelling marketing content, such as blog articles, website copy, social media posts, infographics, videos, and other digital assets, ensuring consistency and alignment with the brand message and values. Analyzing and reporting: Monitor marketing campaign performance using analytics to optimize marketing efforts and achieve business goals.Compensation:Develop contacts with the high school and university sector in PakistanGenerate leads for Canadian, UK, and German student placement, and also for Canadian immigration generally.

Title: Research Analyst
Description: The specific duties and responsibilities of a Research Analyst may include:Collecting and organizing data from various sources, such as surveys, databases, and reports.Conducting qualitative and quantitative analysis of data using statistical software and other analytical tools.Developing and implementing research methodologies to ensure the accuracy and validity of the data.Interpreting and analyzing research findings, and preparing reports to communicate the results to stakeholders.Presenting research findings to clients, colleagues, and other stakeholders, both verbally and in writing.Collaborating with team members and stakeholders to identify research needs and develop research questions.Staying up-to-date with the latest research methods and trends, and applying them to ongoing research projects.Ensuring the confidentiality and security of research data.Job Requirements:Analytical skills: ability to collect, organize, and analyze data from various sources and draw meaningful conclusions.Problem-solving skills: Ability to identify and solve complex problems using critical thinking and data analysis.Communication skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills to present research findings to stakeholders.Attention to detail: Ability to maintain accuracy and attention to detail while writing scripts or collecting and analyzing data.Research skills: Knowledge of research methodologies and techniques to design and conduct research studies.Time management skills: Ability to manage multiple research projects and meet deadlines.Collaboration skills: Ability to work in a team environment and collaborate with colleagues and stakeholders.Technical skills: Proficiency in reading research papers is a must. It fosters a friendly yet exciting and challenging work environment. Title: Head Digital Transformation Office
Description: PSW Digital Transformation OfficePSW has recently launched its Digital Transformation Office to manage and transform the trade ecosystem on a modernized basis. PSW's DTO is a combination of people, processes, metrics, methodologies, and tools, that centrally drives, and manages the diverse set of digital initiatives in the organization.For this purpose, PSW is now looking for a dynamic Head of Transformation office to lead and align PSW's future foresight, evaluate its digital maturity, identify digital opportunities, define a digital transformation roadmap, implement digital initiatives, and harness digital capabilities through robust learning and development programs. The Head of DTO will work as part of the team delivering the Digital Transformation initiatives. They will take responsibility for program delivery and ensure that delivery is underpinned by a professional approach to program and project management, ensuring that activity is being delivered on schedule as per agreed quality standards and within budget. The role will include line management responsibility for the Digital Transformation Office.Responsibilities:Develop the institution's capability to deliver projects by maturing the DTO (Digital Transformation Services) and creating a delivery focal point for project information, progress and expertise.Lead on all PSW’s Programs/Projects w.r.t planning, coordination, collaboration, and monitoring of activities and support alignment of various activities against holistic strategic drivers promoting commonality of approach, process, and documentation.Ensure that deliverables, objectives, and outcomes of the project(s) are achieved as specified, within agreed timelines, as per agreed quality standardsLead project meetings and facilitate workshops as required, producing & presenting written and oral reports/management information to Senior Management and other stakeholders as appropriate.Identify, document, analyze and, if required, challenge internal & external customer requirements, ensuring the project meets business needs / strategic aimsUndertake detailed project planning & documentation (defining project deliverables, success criteria, benefits management, dependencies, change control, risk management) including escalating risks & issues as required.Closely monitor project progress, performance, and quality, including evaluation and benefits realizationManage the operational running and continuous improvement of a Digital Transformation Office, including implementation of PMI standards and best practices and any required resource recruitment and subsequent skills development activities based on business requirements.Be a champion for strategic change. Set up and maintain, in collaboration with other senior Service stakeholders’ processes and documentation of appropriate rigor andFlexibility to enable swift and smooth delivery of change projects including due diligence on downstream support and longer-term operational running of new/updated services.Exercise rigorous change control and guard against scope creep, whilst ensuring means of engagement for future opportunities and appropriate capture are provided.Manage own continuous professional development, internal collaborations and external networks, to contribute to service quality, research excellence and innovation.Work closely with the Senior Management Team to drive forward the department’s value proposition, performance, and reputation, the PSW’s future foresight and subsequent delivery and continuous improvement of PMO processes and wider interactions.Monitor and report progress against plans through regular reviews and maintain close contact with all stakeholders for tracking project implementation, and identification of implementation gaps if any.Create a Center of Excellence in alignment with Project Management Institute (PMI) guidelines, quality standards, and company requirements.Lead and provide guidance to Project Managers for the delivery of projects/programs on time, within scope and on budget.Develop, implement, and govern program management processes, dashboards, templates, policies, and metrics.Monitor compliance with project policies and standards.Interface with executives to define project priorities, implementation opportunities, and challenges and communicate project risks and opportunities.Qualification & Experience:Bachelors or Master’s in Business Administration, Computer Science / Information Technology, Project Management, or any relevant.10+ years of relevant work experience in managing large and complex programs with setting up a Transformation or Project Management office in a public or private sector organization.Strong leadership qualities and organizational skills as well as the ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities, assignments, and roles.Exceptional knowledge of Agile/Scrum/Lean principles and practices.Strong knowledge of SDLC principles and practices.Experience using Click UP/ JIRA / Zoho /Atlassian/ Slack workflow will be preferred.PMP or PgMP is highly desired.Understanding of business processes of cross border trade will be an added advantageExcellent verbal, written, and presentation skills. In particular, a demonstrated ability to effectively communicate technical and business issues and solutions to multiple organizational levels internally and externally as needed to support the strategic goals.Delivering high-profile, approved business transformation projects.
Min Experience: 10 Years (10+ years of relevant work experience in managing large and complex programs with setting up a Transformation or Project Management office in a public or private sector organization.)

Title: Customs / Logistics Specialist
Description: A Customs and Logistics Specialist is responsible for managing and coordinating customs clearance and logistics operations to ensure the efficient movement of goods across international borders. This role requires a deep understanding of customs regulations, international trade processes, and logistics management. The Customs and Logistics Specialist works closely with various stakeholders, including customs authorities, freight forwarders, shipping companies, and internal teams to ensure compliance and timely delivery of goods.Key Duties & ResponsibilitiesCustoms Compliance: Stay up-to-date with customs regulations, tariff codes, and trade compliance requirements. Ensure compliance with import and export laws, regulations, and documentation requirements for various countries.Documentation and Clearance: Prepare and review import/export documentation, including commercial invoices, packing lists, customs declarations, and certificates of origin. Coordinate with freight forwarders and customs brokers to ensure accurate and timely customs clearance.Tariff Classification: Determine the correct tariff classification for imported/exported goods. Identify and apply for relevant duty exemptions, preferential trade agreements, and free trade agreements.Customs Audit and Risk Management: Conduct internal audits to ensure compliance with customs regulations. Identify and mitigate potential risks related to customs duties, penalties, and audits.Freight Management: Coordinate shipments with freight forwarders, carriers, and shipping agents. Arrange transportation, monitor cargo movement, and track shipments to ensure on-time delivery.Supply Chain Coordination: Collaborate with internal teams, including procurement, sales, and warehouse, to ensure seamless logistics operations. Coordinate inventory management, order fulfillment, and distribution activities.Vendor Management: Build and maintain relationships with customs brokers, freight forwarders, and other logistics service providers. Evaluate vendor performance, negotiate contracts, and optimize costs.Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline customs and logistics processes, reduce costs, and improve efficiency. Implement best practices and leverage technology solutions to enhance operations.Compliance Reporting: Prepare and submit required reports to customs authorities and regulatory agencies. Maintain accurate records and documentation related to customs and logistics activities.Sills & QualificationsAdvanced knowledge in the following programming languages:Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, international trade, logistics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).In-depth knowledge of customs regulations, import/export processes, and international trade compliance in Pakistan.Familiarity with tariff classification, customs valuation, and duty drawback programs.Experience in managing customs clearance, freight forwarding, and logistics operations.Strong attention to detail and excellent analytical skills.Proficient in using customs and trade management software systems.Effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with various stakeholders.Ability to work under pressure, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.Understanding of Incoterms, shipping documentation, and international trade terms.Knowledge of global supply chain practices and logistics optimization strategies.Microsoft ProjectExcelPower PointSAP S4HANA & ARIBA SLP

This team comes together across eight different locations every single day to craft enterprise grade applications that serve a large customer base with growing demand and usage. You will use a wide range of technologies and cultivate a collaborative environment with other internal teams.The Role: As a Salesforce Developer with the Order to Cash (OTC) technology team, you will be responsible for developing & providing support across a variety of products within S&P Global. demonstrated success as a problem solver, operating as a client-focused self-starter.Willing to work in Evening/ Night Shift.Educational Qualifications:Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Computer EngineeringGood to Have:Experience or familiarity with Azure DevOpsProven record of accomplishment in solution focused problem-solving skillsExperience working with globally distributed teams utilizing agile practices.#LI-USA-----------------------------------------------------------Equal Opportunity EmployerS&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Title: Senior Associate, Insurance Client Services
Description: The Team: The role involves being one of the main client contact in providing them support on maximizing the use of the product. On a daily basis, the associate’s time is spent in addressing client questions and requests about the platform/excel add-in and is also responsible for escalating issues and inquiries to other teams if necessary, communicating with internal content teams, account management, and sales.The Impact:· Along with providing the best product in the market is providing the best support for it. Associates have a direct impact on the quality of the support provided, hence directly affecting the client's perspective of the quality of the company as a whole.· Since the Associates are directly contacting clients, they also have the opportunity to relay feedback to the company and understand the needs of the clients which is valuable to the development of the Platform.· Additionally, you’ll help to accelerate the quality and timeliness of the data, improve operational efficiency to reduce error rates, and improve support survey scores to help maintain retention rates and drive revenue increases.What’s in it for you:· Associates are trained to be experts in using the products and given that they receive on a day to day basis feedback from clients, they have a good opportunity to explore roles in the product management/content side of the operations.· Since they have client interaction experiences as well, they also have a good position to discover opportunities in account management and sales.· Develop your industry knowledge by working with our diverse client base at various financial institutions, government organizations & universities located across the world.Responsibilities:· Responsible for providing the industry-based client support to S&P clients, across the world.· Accountable for proactively handling inbound client inquiries - phone calls, emails and chats.· Adaptable to learn recent macro-economic & industry events and enhancements in S&P products.· Ability to independently manage the interactions with various unified teams.· Work as a team member to achieve the department targets for client satisfaction.· You would make suggestions in regard to product usability, presentation, and data quality.What We’re Looking For:· Excellent communication skills, basic MS Excel skills, strong critical thinking, and problem solving skills with a high attention to detail.· Basic Insurance knowledge (eg: what are premiums, how an insurance company makes money, different types of Insurance)· Strong working knowledge of the fundamentals of business, financial statements, and investments.· Proficient in research and analysis.· Inclination towards customer-oriented approach, the S&P way.· Ability to multitask and prioritize workflow with little supervision.· The position requires working in rotational shifts.Basic Qualifications: Minimum of a Bachelor's/College degree in Economics, Finance or equivalent.-----------------------------------------------------------Equal Opportunity EmployerS&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Title: Civil Engineer
Description: ABOUT ACTED PAKISTAN:ACTED is a non-governmental organization with headquarters in Paris, founded in 1993. Independent, private and not-for-profit, ACTED respects a strict political and religious impartiality and operates according to the principles of non-discrimination and transparency. ACTED has been present in Pakistan since 1993. ACTED Pakistan programmes range from short-term emergency responses to recovery and rehabilitation, as well as longer-term development initiatives. ACTED strategy is to target vulnerable communities affected by natural and conflict-related disasters as well as lack of socio-economic development. Key responsibilities :The (Civil) Engineer will: Lead and guide ACTED’s technical interventions in the base. Ensure that planned activities are successfully implemented according to quality standards.In collaboration with the programme team and coordination, determine the strategic direction of the programme in the short and medium term and map out activities, and contribute to the preparation of project proposals and budgets;Prepare Bills of Quantities and Designs as required by programmes.Collaborate effectively with other line managers and the coordination team. Manage the programme team. Ensure that they are wholly involved in programme planning and direction.Collaborate with the Appraisal, Monitoring and Evaluation Unit (AMEU) to assess need, monitor activities, and evaluate programme progress.Ensure that lessons learned in the course of implementation are integrated into the programme to ensure that it remains responsive and relevant.Provide input and regularly review all FLAT Follow-Up for ongoing programmes together with the relevant department manager and Programme Coordinator;Be alert to opportunities arising for learning, collaboration and partnership that may enhance programme quality and responsiveness.Provide relevant technical expertise/guidance to ensure that technical quality and standards are maintained during project implementationIdentify and interact with existing WASH initiatives in the base, including UN, GO’s and NGO’s, and community initiatives.Develop and implement an exit strategy in collaboration with his/her team, AME unit and the Programme Coordinator.Liaise with the relevant Technical Working Group / Cluster and its participants/ partners.Report regularly (as requested) to the Area Coordinator and Country Director.Prepare and develop the Project Management tools (i.e. PMF, Logframe).Translate relevant documents or information during coordination visits.Develop team capacity at both the individual and group level by organising/ facilitating trainings internally or through specialist agencies / individuals. Work proactively to ensure that the projects are responsive and relevant to community needs.Accountability to Communities and Beneficiaries The staff member is responsible for ensuring that all relations with the communities we work are conducted in a respectful and consultative manner. Due attention must be paid to ensuring that communities are adequately consulted and informed about ACTED programme objectives, activities, beneficiary selection criteria, and methodologies. This is the responsibility of every ACTED staff member. 1. Programme Management Objective 1.1: Implementation of Project Cycle Management Framework The Civil engineer will ensure that project cycle management tools, including the PMF and Logframe are developed together with Field Officers for all projects undertaken. He/she will ensure that project implementation is conducted within the parameters of the PMF and that this reflects the proposal objectives. The Civil engineer shall undertake regular field coordination visits to ensure that: Objective 1.2: Management of Project Staff The Civil Engineer shall be responsible for the management of technical officers and for ensuring that all field teams are comprehensively briefed on the objective, expected output and overall implementation strategy of any given activity. The Senior Civil engineer shall ensure that technical officers and other project/field staff are given training and complete all the necessary documentation in line with programme requirements. Objective 1.3: Coordination The Civil engineer shall ensure that he/she regularly meets with HR, Finance, and Logistics Departments to ensure that support mechanisms such as the BFU, Procurement plan, and recruitment are completed on time and reflect operational realities/needs. Objective 1.4: Reporting The Civil engineer shall support the Reporting Manager in the preparation of reports to be Senior Civilmitted to Donors / Authorities / Coordination bodies (i.e. OCHA / Internal Coordination). He/she will be expected to provide reports covering activity implementation, achievement of objectives, successes / challenges, beneficiary feedback, etc. The Civil engineer is expected to provide regular reports to the Programme Coordinator on the progress of the implementation of activities and on observations made during the mission and collaborate closely with the AME unit as part of monitoring and evaluation activities. 2. Programme Development Under the direction of the Project Coordinator/Area Coordinator and in coordination with AMEU, the Senior Civil engineer will take the lead in the preparation of, and may be expected to conduct, monitoring or assessment missions to any area as part of the strategic development of ACTED’s operations in the area (i.e. for the development of proposals, for the capitalisation of lessons learned, as part of a wider beneficiary / village selection process, etc.). 3. General Functions - Objective 3.1: Completion of Programme Filing for Completed ProjectsThe Civil engineer shall ensure all relevant filing is properly organized, up-to-date and complete for all projects. He/she shall, also work closely with the FLAT teams to support project reconciliation / general monthly follow-up exercises. Objective 3.2: Commitment to Accountability to Communities The Civil engineer shall take the lead in the development and implementation of a programme-specific accountability framework to act as a guideline for all programme activitiesActivities are correctly completed across the village tracts of intervention and that expected standards are met;Challenges to implementation are identified and addressed in a manner that takes into account beneficiary needs and expectations;Community / beneficiary feedback is collected and shared in programme and coordination meetings;Targeted indicators as stated in the Project Management Framework (PMF) and/or Logframe are met in a satisfactory manner; “ACTED is committed to protecting beneficiaries and staff within our programs from sexual exploitation and abuse (SEA). ACTED has a Code of Conduct and organizational policies, which outline the expected behavior of all staff, consultants and other stakeholders and reminds ACTED’s zero-tolerance approach. Any candidate offered a job with ACTED will sign those documents as part of their work contract and is expected to abide by them.” “ACTED is commitment to zero tolerance to all forms of violence against children, beneficiaries and staff. ACTED is equal opportunity employers. Females and minorities are encouraged to apply. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Final selection will be based on security clearance of the candidate.”

aid you in new career paths within the S&P Global Commercial organization.Responsibilities: As a senior member of our team, you are expected to make an impact right from the beginning.Provide all items that are EOL, Added, Removed, Price decreased/IncreasePerforming ad-hoc items removals, additions etc. based on requirementsSending reports of each customer’s bids to SDMs and following the instructions of SDMs in managing the customer’s catalogPerforming comparison on the domestic catalog for EOL items and submitting them to the SDM.Performing pricing analysis on the domestic price file to make sure prices are not highly variant and submitting them to SDMReporting timely to SDMs on their accounts if any bid of any country or globally is unavailable or removed by OEMUpdating as per customers' bid on monthly and often bi-monthly bases, based on SDMs instructionsUpdating monthly exchange rates on each running OEM where applicableWhat you'll need:A Complete understanding of the ERP system (OneSource, HP Portal, Dell Portal, CNET and other portals).Quality Assurance(QA) knowledge to find errors or bugs in the software/system.Excellent Communication skillsData analytical skillsConfidence in handling large and complex data (Advanced MS Excel expertise)Basic understanding of IT infrastructureBasic understanding of how IT items are priced. This is from accessories to laptops to serversBasic understanding of global exchange rates and how they differ per region/country/OEMAbility to effectively communicate to the SDM team on discrepancies or potential challenges when updating catalogsA bachelor's degree from a reputable universityPassion to work in a fast-paced environmentWe welcome candidates of all experience levels who are open to learning our processes, standards, and tools. Title: Global Practice Lead - Data Science
Description: Position Overview Teradata is looking to onboard a Senior Manager role to manage and lead the Data Science teams across GDC Centers. Interested candidates should have strong analytical skills, cross industry business understanding with excellent communication skills and Data warehousing concepts. In addition, the candidate should have prior managerial experience for mentoring and leading large and globally located teams of advance analytics consultants. Job Specification Reporting to Analytics Practice Head, the candidate will manage and lead the data science teams in terms of pre-sales support, delivery engagement and capability development. Pre-sales Support Proactively work with GDC Analytics Practice leadership in developing strong prepositions around Teradata GDC analytics consulting practices and services. Work with Teradata global analytics communities to gain strategy insights, product features and roadmaps for staying ahead in supporting accounts and GTM teams globally. Support global sales and engagement teams in developing Teradata Clearscape analytics value propositions and developing data science solutions architecture. Support and work with Data Science teams to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements. As a GDC focal point, take the responsibility for effort estimations and support the pre-sales lifecycle. Data Science Solutions Delivery Support Support and mentor Teradata GDC Data Science delivery teams in supporting account teams, prospective customers, and global analytics initiatives. Help the team in analyzing and understanding customer requirements through extensive data exploration phases. Support POCs and Pilot Projects to highlight the benefits of Teradata’s driven Advanced Analytics use cases. Exposure to Artificial Intelligence and Deep Learning is a plus Hands on experience over Cloud platform e.g., AWS, Azure or GCP is preferred Strong hands on with data wrangling and crunching to develop the right insights Present findings to IT and Business stakeholders. Actively participate in brain storming sessions to produce viable solutions/analytics. Should have hands on experience with any or few of the tools like SAS, Teradata Vantage, DataIKU, Azure ML, AWS Sage Maker etc., KXEN, SPSS, Python, R etc., to deliver the required analytics solutions Strong analytics skills with business understanding of multiple industries. In depth understanding of Machine Learning concepts and statistical modeling. Data Science Capability Development Responsible Teradata GDC’s Data Science capability frameworks. Ensure that all such capability tools and techniques are up to date w.r.t to Teradata Product roadmap and Analytics industry trends. Develop the learning path, assign learning path to different Data Science roles and support in evaluating the overall ranking in the competency framework. Work with the Analytics Leadership in evaluating the overall team’s performance and develop strategy and initiatives to optimize the data science team in terms of structure, quality, and capability. Leadership skills Identifies and resolves complex multi-dimensional business problems The job requires good investigative skills as well as evaluative judgment based on the analysis of factual and qualitative information in complicated or new situations Jobs possess an elevated level of communication skills including interactive listening in order to influence and negotiate with others External communication is required including an elevated level of tact and diplomacy with internal/external clients, customers, and vendors. Strong story building skills. Communicates complex concepts, anticipates potential objections, and persuades senior leaders to adopt a different point of view May participate in relevant client industry conferences, etc. Impacts the business results of area(s) of responsibility by setting priorities, allocating resources, and developing policies and plans The job has an impact by exercising control over resources, policy formulation and planning The job has primary accountability for the end results of decisions made and executed upon Guided by the broader business organization strategic plans, impacts the department results by supporting and funding of projects, products, services and/or technologies Candidate Profile Minimum Master’s Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Administration or Statistics. Preferably a Post Doctorate in the relevant field 12+ years’ experience in data driven field (e.g., Data Science, DWH, Analytics etc.). 3-4 years of experience in managerial role leading the Data Science or Analytics teams

Title: Coordinator Quality Improvement
Description: General Position Summary: Coordinator, Quality Improvement, will be responsible for providing operational, technical, and implementation support in ensuring quality while enhancing interventions in Mercy Corps’ TB Programme including bacteriological positivity, upfront testing on Gene Xpert, improvement in quality and target achievement of TB rifampicin-resistant (RR) cases, implementation of TB Preventive Treatment (TPT) interventions, and other associated quality aspects in different components of the program. S/he will be responsible for maintaining close liaison with national and provincial TB control programs and Mercy Corp’s sub-recipients (SRs). S/he will review the program data, plan field visits accordingly, and develop and maintain close coordination with the onboard General Physicians/Specialists/hospital administrations. On a regular basis, s/he will support the M&E team in resolving and addressing the quality related issues faced in implementation. S/he will strengthen the capacity of the program team and of implementing partners to ensure quality aspects of interventions as per the operational and technical guidelines. Essential Job Responsibilities: Management & DEVELOPMENT OF QUALITY IMPLMENTATION INTERVENTIONS Support the seniors and core team in the implementation of a “Quality Improvement Plan” that will address the root causes of quality issues in the overall implementation of TB interventions.Support the team and SR staff in ensuring that the mapping of Private Healthcare Providers (PHCPs) clinics and taking onboard new ones in the program is done in accordance with the mapping guidelines.Support the enhanced case finding (ECF) component and SR staff in ensuring the quality aspects of the mapping of GeneXpert laboratories and developing a plan for the installation of Gene Xpert in the private sector.Coordinate with all the onboard PHCPs in his/her assigned district(s) and orient them on presumptive referrals and the significance of a bacteriological confirmed diagnosis and ensure quality aspects.Provide on-job orientation to the paramedics/lab technicians on collection of quality sputum sample as per the guidelines.Support RCs and DFSs in the expansion of stool testing via GeneXpert at the private sector Xpert sitesMaintain strong coordination with the District TB Coordinators and Provincial Program Officers for the provision of feedback to the onboard PHCP clinics and ECF hospitals on how to improve the quality of diagnosis and management of TBMaintain strong coordination with the District Lab Supervisors for provision of feedback to the lab technician/Xpert Incharge on ensuring the quality of sputum sample testingWork closely with the RCs and provide support in reviewing their monthly work plans, reports and provide feedback.Ensure improvement in the PPM clinics/Large private hospitals where proportion of bacteriological confirmed cases is less and decide remedial actions with consultations of SRs. Closely follow-up with SRs and oversee the implementation of the action plans developed based on field findings.Conduct and assist in on-the-job mentoring and training of the field staff especially in terms of quality assurance aspects.Support SRs in developing liaison and coordination with PMDT sites to reduce the pre-enrollment of RR cases, if and when necessaryUtilizing the platform of QRMs and round table meetings as advocacy and orientation tool for uptake of TB Preventive therapy (TPT) and significance of bacteriological confirmation in TB diagnosis and managementPeriodic visits to active case finding (ACF) camps, provide on-site mentoring to the field staff in quality assurance perspective especially in collection of sputum samples and its subsequent testing on Xpert, while keeping the ACF advisor updated.Monitor the implementation of specimen transport intervention in his/her assigned district(s), identify the gaps and suggest actions to the specimen transport teamEnsure program implementation is responsive to the communities and partners and consistent with Mercy Corps’ relevant program guidelines, principles, values, quality standards and strategic plan.Confirm beneficiaries are effectively targeted according to transparent criteriaWork in close coordination with QA coordinator to ensure the quality of performance of PPM labsSupervision, quality assurance and reporting Work closely with Component leads, Manager Monitoring and Data Management for in-depth data analysis of program data, to ensure development/implementation of targeted interventions that can lead to high yield while ensuring quality implementation.Make monthly field visits to the assigned district(s) and assess the quality of the interventions and make recommendations accordingly.Make quarterly visits to SRs offices for data review align with M&E officersAny other duties assigned by the supervisorAccountabilityReports Directly To: Senior Technical AdvisorWorks Directly With: Director of Programs, Senior Program Manager, Manager Monitoring and Data Management, MEL Manager, PR Component Leads, Finance and Operations teams, Team Leader South, and Project Manager PIU.Knowledge and Experience:Medical Doctor and/or master’s degree in public health or any other relevant discipline. At least five years of work experience in program implementation. Previous experience in implementing The Global Fund grants desirable while previous experience with a variety of donors will be an added advantage. Experience of managing large scale projects is preferred. Experience in TB control will be a plus. Excellent writing skills require. Track record of implementing quality enhancement programs and maintaining liaison with governmental and non-governmental partners. Proficiency in written and spoke English. Experience of donor reporting and grant management is required. Only shortlisted candidates will be called for interview. Organization reserves the right to accept or reject any or all CV(s) without assigning any reason.We are an equal employment opportunity employer and female are strongly encouraged to apply.
Min Experience: 5 Years (At least five years of work experience in program implementation)

Title: Business Development Executive
Description: Remote job. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Business Development Executive Executive to join our team remotely. As a remote team member, you will be responsible for generating leads in the USA target area through Google My Business (GMB), emailing target prospect clients, following up with phone calls, and ultimately closing deals or referring prospects for virtual meetings. The ideal candidate should be fluent in English and possess a strong understanding of the ad agency business. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, are crucial for building and maintaining relationships with potential clients. This role requires a proactive and self-driven individual with a proven track record in sales and business development. Responsibilities: Utilize Google My Business (GMB) and other online platforms to identify potential leads in the USA target area. Conduct thorough research on prospects to understand their business needs and requirements. Craft persuasive and personalized emails to engage target prospect clients, highlighting the benefits of our services. Follow up with prospects via phone calls to establish rapport, address inquiries, and schedule virtual meetings. Collaborate with the internal team to ensure a smooth handoff of leads and provide necessary information to support the sales process. Continuously track and manage leads using a CRM system, updating information and maintaining accurate records. Stay up to date with industry trends, market developments, and competitor activities to identify new opportunities. Achieve and exceed sales targets and contribute to the overall growth of the business. Requirements: Proven experience in sales and business development, preferably in the ad agency or marketing industry. Strong knowledge of the USA market and understanding of the ad agency business model. Title: Senior IT Project Manager
Description: We are currently hiring a Senior Project Manager to work with Client and Engineering Teams and lead high impact projects to ensure that they are delivered on time and within the budgeted cost. Responsibilities Discover and interpret the needs of clients. Consult with client on the proper methodology to achieve their goals. Monitor the work of other Client Services (CS) team members in their efforts to meet client needs. Directly manages all aspects of the project lifecycle and works with matrix IT partners to oversee all Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) phases of a project. Lead the day-to-day activities of team members, ensure alignment to ERP solution processes/best practices, and work with project managers to develop, establish and maintain project management standards and procedures. Responsible for contributing to the development of detailed project plans; identifying resource needs to support delivery efforts and coordinating the daily activities of the teams in alignment with project plans and client goals. Obtain feedback from clients to ensure that project efforts meet expectations for contracted time, cost and performance. Provide company leadership with feedback once acquired. Responsible for professional development of assigned team members. Perform other duties as assigned. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, or a similar field, with 7+ years of experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Highly organized and able to manage multiple processes. Knowledge of various project management methodologies (e.g., agile/scrum) A project management certification (e.g. PMP) would be a plus. Exemplary core knowledge of and expertise in the use of project management methodologies, tools and processes including Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and Agile Framework. Ability to navigate a matrixed organization effectively. Solid influencing skills. Demonstrated, applied experience establishing and delivering large-scale, complex projects.
Location: Islamabad, Faisalabad, Gujranwala, Lahore, Rawalpindi, Gujrat, Pakistan

Title: Lightning Protection Inspector
Description: The Lightning Protection Inspector is responsible for conducting inspections and assessments of lightning protection systems to ensure they are installed, maintained, and functioning correctly. This role involves inspecting structures, such as buildings, towers, and facilities, to identify potential risks and vulnerabilities related to lightning strikes. The Lightning Protection Inspector works closely with project teams, contractors, and stakeholders to ensure compliance with applicable codes, standards, and best practices for lightning protection.Responsibilities:Inspection and Assessment:Conduct inspections of structures to assess their vulnerability to lightning strikes.Inspect existing lightning protection systems to ensure compliance with industry standards and specifications.Identify potential risks and deficiencies in the lightning protection system and recommend necessary improvements.Verify the proper installation and grounding of lightning rods, conductors, surge protection devices, and related components.Compliance and Documentation:Review and interpret lightning protection codes, regulations, and project specifications to ensure adherence.Document and report any non-compliance, deficiencies, or deviations from approved plans and standards.Prepare detailed inspection reports, including findings, recommendations, and corrective actions required.Maintain accurate records and documentation of all inspections and assessments performed.Collaboration and Communication:Coordinate with project teams, contractors, and stakeholders to schedule inspections and address any quality-related issues.Provide guidance and support to contractors regarding compliance with lightning protection standards and specifications.Communicate inspection findings and recommendations to relevant parties in a clear and concise manner.Collaborate with engineers and designers to review lightning protection system designs and provide input on installation requirements.Education and Training:Stay updated with the latest lightning protection codes, standards, and industry practices.Participate in training programs and workshops to enhance knowledge and skills related to lightning protection inspections.Provide training and guidance to project teams and contractors on lightning protection best practices.Continuous Improvement:Identify opportunities for process improvement and recommend best practices for lightning protection.Stay informed about advancements in lightning protection technology and industry trends.Assist in the development and improvement of lightning protection inspection procedures and protocols.Qualifications:A high school diploma or equivalent; further education or certification in electrical engineering or a related field is preferred.Proven experience as a Lightning Protection Inspector or a similar role, with a focus on lightning protection systems.Strong knowledge of lightning protection codes, regulations, and industry standards (e.g., NFPA 780, IEC 62305).Familiarity with lightning protection system components, such as lightning rods, conductors, surge protection devices, and grounding systems.Excellent attention to detail and ability to identify defects, vulnerabilities, and non-compliance.Effective communication skills to collaborate with project teams, contractors, and stakeholders.Ability to read and interpret construction drawings and specifications related to lightning protection systems.Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to provide practical solutions.Proficiency in using computer software for documentation and reporting.

Title: Cold Calling Agent
Description: We are seeking a highly motivated and results-oriented individual to join our call center team as a Cold Caller. As a Cold Caller, your primary responsibility will be to make outbound calls to potential customers with the goal of generating leads, setting appointments, or closing sales. This role requires excellent communication skills, persuasive abilities, and a persistent and proactive approach to cold calling. The ideal candidate should be comfortable engaging with individuals over the phone, have a strong work ethic, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.Responsibilities:Conduct outbound calls to a targeted list of potential customers to promote our products/services and generate leads.Engage prospects in meaningful conversations, identify their needs, and effectively communicate the benefits of our offerings.Build rapport with potential customers to establish trust and credibility.Determine and qualify leads by asking relevant questions and gathering key information.Schedule appointments or follow-up calls for interested prospects.Meet or exceed daily/weekly/monthly targets for call volume, lead generation, and conversion rates.Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all interactions and leads in the CRM system.Collaborate with the sales team to ensure smooth handover of qualified leads.Continuously develop product knowledge and keep up-to-date with industry trends and competition.Requirements:Proven experience as a cold caller or telemarketer is preferred.Excellent verbal communication and active listening skills.Ability to engage and build rapport with diverse individuals over the phone.Strong persuasive and negotiation skills.Persistent, proactive, and self-motivated with a desire to achieve targets.Ability to handle objections and rejection in a professional manner.Familiarity with CRM software and proficient in using productivity tools.Strong organizational and time management skills.Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.High school diploma or equivalent; additional qualifications in sales or marketing is a plus.Note: This job description outlines the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this position. It does not include all the duties, responsibilities, and skills required for the role. The company reserves the right to modify, add, or remove duties and responsibilities as needed.

Title: Graphic Designer
Description: We are seeking a talented and creative Graphic Designer to join our team. As a Graphic Designer, you will play a crucial role in creating visually appealing and impactful designs that effectively communicate our brand and engage our target audience. Success in this position entails delivering high-quality designs within deadlines, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and contributing to the overall visual identity of our organization.Responsibilities:Create visually compelling designs for a variety of mediums, including print, digital, and social media platforms.Collaborate with the marketing team to develop creative concepts and design solutions that align with our brand guidelines and effectively communicate our key messages.Design and produce engaging graphics, illustrations, and layouts for marketing materials, including brochures, flyers, banners, social media posts, and advertisements.Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of our target audience, market trends, and design best practices to ensure our designs are relevant, visually appealing, and impactful.Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product development, and sales, to gather requirements and ensure that design projects meet their objectives and specifications.Manage multiple design projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks effectively, and deliver high-quality designs within tight deadlines.Stay up to date with the latest design trends, techniques, and software tools, and actively seek opportunities to enhance your design skills and knowledge.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, or a related field (or equivalent experience).Proven experience as a Graphic Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing your creative and technical skills.Proficiency in graphic composition.Strong attention to detail and the ability to deliver pixel-perfect designs.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively present and articulate design concepts and ideas.Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and take feedback constructively.Strong time management and organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and web design principles is a plus.Experience in motion graphics and video editing is a plus. Overall, the Graphic Designer role is essential in shaping our organization's visual identity and creating designs that captivate our target audience. By combining your creativity, technical expertise, and strong collaboration skills, you will contribute to the success of our marketing campaigns and help elevate our brand to new heightsExtra Benefits:Health InsurancePaid leavesInternational CertificationsPerformance based annual bonusPerformance based annual increments

Title: Senior Unity Game Developer
Description: As a Senior Unity Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-quality Unity-based applications. You will work closely with the development team and collaborate with designers and artists to create engaging and immersive experiences. Your role will involve leading and mentoring junior developers, participating in code reviews, and contributing to the overall technical strategy of the projects.Responsibilities: Game Development: Design, develop, and optimize Unity-based games and applications using C# and Unity's scripting API.Technical Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of junior developers, providing guidance and support throughout the development process.Collaboration: Collaborate with designers, artists, and other team members to implement game features, mechanics, and visual effects.Code Review: Conduct thorough code reviews to ensure high-quality, maintainable, and efficient code practices.Performance Optimization: Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, memory leaks, and other technical issues to deliver optimized and smooth gameplay experiences.Prototyping: Rapidly prototype new gameplay ideas and concepts to explore innovative game mechanics and features.Documentation: Create and maintain technical documentation, including design documents, coding standards, and best practices.Research and Development: Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends, tools, and technologies related to game development and Unity to provide insights and recommendations.Project Management: Collaborate with project managers to define project timelines, milestones, and deliverables, and ensure timely completion of tasks.Quality Assurance: Participate in the testing and debugging process to ensure the quality and stability of the developed applications. Requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.Extensive experience in Unity game development, including a strong understanding of the Unity engine and its various subsystems.Proficiency in C# programming language and Unity's scripting API.Proven experience in designing and implementing gameplay mechanics, UI/UX systems, and game physics.Strong knowledge of software engineering principles, design patterns, and best practices for maintainable and scalable code.Experience with version control systems, such as Git, for collaborative development.Solid understanding of 3D mathematics, algorithms, and data structures.Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills, with the ability to identify and resolve complex technical issues.Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.Prior experience in leading and mentoring a team of developers is preferred.Familiarity with agile development methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban, is a plus.Experience with multiplayer and networking in Unity is a bonus.

Title: Application Associate, Financing Modeling
Description: The Role:S&P Global Market Intelligence is seeking an Application Associate to join our Financial Modeling team within Client Operations in Ahmedabad.The Team:The Financial Modeling & Client Operations teams are primary touchpoints for our clients and are the “face” of the company. Going above and beyond in our service offering is where these teams add value. The Financial Modeling team is a powerful synergy of diverse skills, talents and cultures spread across multiple locations. We are customer-focused and results-oriented providing exposure to a wide array of products, platforms and processes globally. We nurture open and transparent communication, and a great work-life balance, with a positive work culture where team members are recognized for their work. We meet challenges head-on and work for solutions as one team. We work hard and play harder – we participate in cultural and sports events within as well as outside of the company, and also contribute back to the society through the company’s corporate social responsibility efforts.​​What's in it for you?As an Application Associate in Financial Modeling, you will learn, explore, educate and support usage of excel-based products and financial information via customers of capital and commodity markets, where you will hold investigative conversations with clients to drive product usage, retention and revenue. You will leverage your financial market knowledge, your strong customer service skills and exceptional troubleshooting abilities to help the clients with their requests, while showcasing your vast knowledge of our tools, our data and the industries we cover. Many of the Fortune 500 companies in the world will be asking for your help to find solutions to their challenges. You will also be the Client’s advocate and work with different teams inside the organization across many functional areas (Sales, Technology, Content, Industry Research etc.)You will also play a major role in executing and improving BAU proactive processes to prevent issues and improve delivery quality to our clients. In the process you will suggest improvements to the product as well as perform Agile-based User-Acceptance-Testing to curb issues even before they hit our clients.​​Principle Responsibilities:​​Develop financial models in MS Office products for internal/external clients to help them in their routine workflow/analysis.Consistently make proactive suggestions in regards to product usability, presentation, and data quality.Be the primary point of contact for providing critical research and value-adding knowledge to our diverse client base at various financial institutions, corporations, government organizations and universities.Support the client base in their research by responding to their requests which come in via calls, e-mails and other forms of communication. Conduct direct interactions with clients through phone, email and video conferences, as they relate to industry, platform and data questions.What are we looking for?Master’s Degree in Finance, Business or Economics. Candidates pursuing the CFA charter is a plus. Good knowledge and understanding of capital and commodity marketsGood understanding of accounting standards. Strong communication and interpersonal skills.Fluency and eloquence in English is required.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; knowledge of MS Office products and understanding of databases is a plus.VBA Knowledge is a plusExperience with Salesforce or similar CRM applications is a plus.Willingness to work in rotational shifts.Grade: 7 ALocation: GurgaonAbout S&P Global Market IntelligenceWe deliver exceptional solutions, for exceptional results.Every day at S&P Global Market Intelligence we collect, scrub, interpret, and analyze vast volumes of content, turning it into actionable intelligence on the global financial markets and the companies and industries that comprise those markets.We deliver the data and insight you need to make informed, smarter business decisions and investment decisions that are critical to your future.-----------------------------------------------------------Equal Opportunity EmployerS&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Title: ISO AUDITOR AND TRAINER
Description: JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:As a Lead Auditor you will be responsible for planning and carrying out various management system audits as per the assigned audit criteria. You will conduct audits (either remote or on-site) in accordance with the relevant ISO management system standard(s) and provide technical support to ensure value added auditing services.Moreover, you must maintain a high standard of service delivery to ensure credibility, positive customer relationships and continued business growth; complete all audit activities within the specified timeframe to ensure business efficiency and provide accurate and timely reporting to help plan and manage over all audit operations.HIGH LEVEL OVERVIEW of your responsibilities includes, but is not limited to:Conducting 3rd Party Management System Certification Audits and TrainingsEstablishing Audit Program and Plan in advance of an auditEffectively communicating audit planning and audit results with auditee and the Head OfficePreparing and presenting audit findings, including nonconformitiesReviewing and approving Corrective Action Plans and verify effectiveness of Corrective Action Plans to close out non-conformitiesPreparing audit packs for the Head Office and address any issuesRegularly traveling to client site to conduct onsite audits within the GCC regionQUALIFICATIONS:Requirements for Success in the Role of AuditorExtensive and recent auditing and training experience.Lead Auditor status in multiple management system standards such as 14001, 45001 and 9001, and qualified to the latest version of these standards.Varied breadth of industry sector experience (IAF/NACE codes), ideally across the construction, oil and gas, manufacturing, public and service sectors, and steelworks/metal industries.Have held positions with significant Quality, Health, Safety and Environmental management system responsibility.Demonstrate strong working knowledge and experience of ISO 9001, ISO 45001, and ISO 14001 management system standards, compliance, and auditing techniques.

Title: Change Management Analyst
Description: The Title: Change Management Analyst The Location: Islamabad, Pakistan The Grade: 09 (relevant for internal employees)The Team: The Organization Change Management Team exists to prepare, support, and equip our people to successfully adopt change by providing an innovative, effective and sustainable change management that aligns to the business goals and accelerates growth for Market Intelligence. Our Key focus areas are; defining, driving and delivering the change management programs for the entire suite of tools and technology used by MI Division commercial users with solid success metrics and KPIs for change and adoption. Additionally we ensure there is relevant governance & executive sponsorship for change, including interaction with senior management, advisory groups, working groups, champions, super users/ end users while providing effective communications and engagement. The Impact: The OCM team supports / provides change management expertise to several large complex transformational projects. This includes a Salesforce migration and consolidation (Cumulus) plus CPQ and billing upgrades (Sunrise), many smaller projects, and business as usual change. The OCM team will collaborate with Sales Leaders and individuals in order to define the change impacts of any planned change (H,M,L) and to ensure there is sufficient planning and awareness of any change project and is duly recorded in the master change road map within change control guidelines. The OCM team applies a structured methodology to achieve successful organizational change management; including for significant projects, new technologies, major system consolidation projects, and BAU including system upgrades, releases and announcements. What's in it for you: At any given time, this role will be assisting with the change management success for several large, complex transformational projects, many smaller projects, and business as usual change. The role’s primary focus is to support the documentation of change impacts, preparation of change reporting / dashboarding, delivering of change training for colleagues. The role will require close collaboration with other managers and teams across the Division, as well as in supporting Finance functions. Responsibilities: Work with the Change Director to support the design of the organization change management program accordingly. Conduct Change Impact Assessments and Business Readiness analysis for impacted teams. Description: About your jobChartIQ is seeking a Senior Technical Writer to produce and own all publicly shared technical documentation, training and reference material for our HTML5 Charting Library (), to ensure it is concise, easy to understand and current. In addition, you will work with the Product and Marketing teams to promote and position the product.The successful candidate will be a hands-on user of our software platform & tools, and independently produce customer facing documentation that will cover the full range from low-level API's to architecture diagrams and how-to guides, including producing sample code to showcase the use of the API. Candidates should have solid software development experience as well as superior communication skills. This role will work, as part of our development, team to maintain and extend our developer portal (documentation.chartiq.com)Specific Responsibilities:A Technical Writer must be able to communicate complex information clearly, concisely and accurately, and without relying on jargon. Your role involves tasks such as writing conceptual overviews and procedures, reading and writing example code, or updating help center queries and FAQs. As a Technical Writer at ChartIQ you will be a key link between Client Developers, ChartIQ Engineers, Product Managers, and Marketing.Design and organize documentation sets for new APIs and developer products.Create and organize internal technical information for developer processes, product features and new technologies.Create technical documentation for our open sourced products.Identify and propose solutions for major improvements to processes.Supplement documentation with relevant sample code and/or visuals needed to enhance the written word.About you5+ years experience writing documentation for developers (APIs, SDKs, web technologies) and other forms of technical content for software applications.You have tackled internal and external documentation projects that have made life easier for developers of all experience levels.Technical skillsYou are able to understand and then explain highly technical information leveraging a background in engineering or computer science in order to do this.You are comfortable with HTML and CSS; proficiency in a UNIX environment.You have previous experience with and know your way around wikis, blogs, and GitHub.Communication and TeamworkYou are able to take complex, technical information and translate it for colleagues and consumers who have nontechnical backgrounds.You ask the right questions and get the right details from highly technical and very busy people. You like to work cross-functionally with product managers, account managers, project managers and technical teams.Motivated and OrganizedYou are highly organized, self-motivated and love to bring order to chaos. You are a detail oriented person who can clearly state every step so that the instructions can be useful.You like to use your imagination to think about a procedure or product in the way that a person without technical experience would think about it.You have a natural curiosity for learning how things work.You’re not afraid of adjusting to changes midstream and are excited about using your creativity to solve problems.Bachelor’s degree in Technical Writing, Technical Communication, English or a related field-----------------------------------------------------------Equal Opportunity EmployerS&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Title: Regional Finance Coordinator
Description: Islamic Relief Worldwide is an independent humanitarian and development organization, serving humanity for over 36 years. With an active presence in over 40 countries across the globe, we strive to make the world a better and fairer place for those affected by poverty, conflicts and natural disasters.Our Regional Finance Team are currently recruiting for the position of Regional Finance Coordinator. The RFC will;1- Provide financial support to the regional office and support the capacity building of country office finance staff under the supervision of Regional Finance Manager.2. Maintain good relations and understanding between IRW, Regional and Country offices and finance functions on a regular basis.3. Review budget proposals, monthly financial information, review funds transfer requests, consolidate reports and produce timely and accurate financial information at regional level.The successful candidate must have or be:1. Good management and financial accounting experience, including a pro-active approach to budget monitoring, reporting etc. with 5-7 years’ experience.2. Degree in Accountancy/Finance and Intermediate Level Qualified or studying final level of AAT/ACCA/CIMA/ICAEW or equivalent professional qualifications.3. Experience of donor, financial accounting, budgets and yearend financial reporting. 4. Excellent communication skills to liaison with regional assigned countries. Strong English communication skills (verbal as well as writing.5. Advance excel skills; in designing and manipulating reports.6. Ability to manage workload of multiple and remote locations, ability to think strategically.7. Ability to work as a team player in a multinational national environment.8. Verbal skills to communicate with all levels in an organization and explain technical or complex financial aspects in a wide range of situations.9. Must have previous exposure and experience of preparing /reviewing budgets.10. Experience of budgeting for project activities, monitor and report on financial activities and undertaken appropriate analysis.11. Good all round business acumen and an understanding of the role of the Finance department in adding value to operational decision making.12. Experience of donor’s financial compliance.If you are talented, reliable, service minded, resilient and a highly motivated professional looking for a meaningful career, with a strong commitment to IRW’s mission and values of sincerity, excellence, compassion, social justice and custodianship, please apply by completing our online application form.Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.Pre-employment Checks: Any employment with Islamic Relief will be subject to the following checks:Screening clearanceReceipt of satisfactory referencesOur values and commitment to safeguarding.IRW is committed to preventing any type of unwanted behavior at work including sexual harassment, exploitation and abuse, lack of integrity and financial misconduct; and committed to promoting the welfare of children, young people, adults and beneficiaries with whom IRW engages. IRW expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment through our code of conduct. We place a high priority on ensuring that only those who share and demonstrate our values are recruited to work for us.The post holder will undertake the appropriate level of training and is responsible for ensuring that they understand and work within the safeguarding policies of the organization.All offers of employment will be subject to satisfactory references and appropriate screening checks, which can include criminal records checks. IRW also participates in the Inter Agency Misconduct Disclosure SchemeIn line with this Scheme, we will request information from job applicants’ previous employers about any findings of sexual exploitation, sexual abuse and/or sexual harassment during employment, or incidents under investigation when the applicant left employment.By submitting an application, the job applicant confirms his/her understanding of these recruitment procedures.Applicants should be sympathetic to the values of Islamic Relief:(Sincerity, Excellence, Compassion, Social Justice and Custodianship)Islamic Relief is an equal opportunities employer

However, based on changing business requirements, you may be required to work in the morning or evening shift.The Impact:As the Senior Associate of the M&D Client Services, along with providing client support, you will be expected to serve as an enabler for the rest of the team so they could provide best-in-class client support and partner up with the users in their key projects and queries where Capital IQ Pro platform can be leveraged. Using this experience, you’ll be conducting diagnostic product webcasts, proactive client outreaches and other similar projects aimed to increase user stickiness and eventually leading to high retention rates.The Team / Business:The Markets & Deals team is responsible for providing client support for our business intelligence tool by holding investigative conversations with clients regarding pricing, credit ratings, institutional ownership along with capital and M&A transactions. You will also work with different teams inside the organization across many functional areas (Sales, Technology, Product Management, Content & Industry Research, etc.)What’s in it for you:Sharpen your professional and social skills while interacting with clients and internal stakeholders.Develop your product knowledge by working with our expansive investment management and investment banking client base.Responsibilities:Provide client support via phone, email and other mediumsMake suggestions regarding product usability, presentation, and data qualityWork with clients and internal colleagues to help build customized, data-driven Excel modelsUplift morale and motivation of associates and be a voice of positivity and establish yourself as POC for any guidance they may needMonitor the quantitative and qualitative performance of team members and communicate key points to M&D managementEnsure you are adept on Capital IQ Pro platform, escalation paths/ SOPs, Salesforce.com, product knowledge, new enhancements, and related continuous educationParticipate in recruiting and hiring process to meet adequate staffing level, as neededWork on special projects/assignments as required and/or assignedQualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or related field or equivalent education and experience1-3 year’s related work experienceExcellent presentation, communication, multitasking and customer service and Client Managements skillsTeam-player mentality with tight-knit teamwork skillsAbout Company Statement:At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction.S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. Title: Commercial Development Representative
Description: The Role: You will be the first impression of Market Intelligence. As part of our front line, you will interact with companies across the border to increase awareness of the value of Market Intelligence analytical solutions and data services. This will include developing the strategy to diagnose and assess whether a company is a good fit for our products and strategize, with internal partners, how to highlight that value.
