We are self-motivated, spirited and passionate, with a client first mind-set. We are resilient, flexible and value excellence in execution. Overall, the team works passionately to increase awareness of the value of our products to accelerate success.The Impact: You'll be the first impression of Market Intelligence and a quarterback, leveraging resources from marketing, product, other teams to match our solutions and services to meet needs. As top of the funnel, you are essential to the organization's overall growth.What’s In it for You: We are looking for someone to grow with the company by evolving their skills and expanding their industry knowledge and product knowledge on market leading analytical solutions and data services. As you grow, there are opportunities for you to transition into areas where you can continue to thrive. Although this could mean accelerating your career within the team, it could transition to other areas like relationship management, customer success, product specialist, operations or project management. Responsibilities: Work through assigned Market Intelligence accounts by segment to determine if a company would benefit from our analytical solutions and data servicesIdentify the right group/users within an organization and engage them in a conversation about our different productsDevelop new conversations with companies from multiple sources including inbound calls, discovery and individual researchDevelop an outreach strategy to drive leads with internal teams Follow up on leads and conduct research to identify companies who will value our products and offerings.Prepare and analyze reports and dashboardsWork on new logo accounts to engage prospects in the buying processBuild and cultivate relationships by initiating communications and conducting follow-up communications in order to introduce companies to other parts of our organizationGrow product knowledgeby sitting in with various team members, attending the demos you set, and asking for feedback on a regular basisContinuous learning to stay on top of tools, techniques, trends, understanding of the market, customers, and competitionTimely management of data for customers and company interactions within CRM, recording all communications, information is accurate, and documents attached.Monitor day-to-day time and priorities to deliver resultsCollaborate with peers, particularly around best practices, competitive intel and various approaches to effectively engage with companies What We’re Looking For: In a nutshell, the right candidate will be one who works well under pressure, thinks out-of-the-box, easily initiates relaxed but informative two-way conversations with companies, and is highly self-motivated. The right candidate will also understand how to assess a company's needs and cater the communication to each company specifically, to raise awareness on how services and solutions can add value.Required Skills:Bachelor’s degree preferred 1-3 years telemarketing and/or commercial experienceAdditional Skills:You have a proven track record of meeting goals, daily/weekly/monthly activity goals, research, and planning goalsA proven track record of strong client relationshipsExcellent client service skillsGoal and action orientated, with ability to work towards targetsExperience in dealing with challenging situations, i.e. objection handling and overcoming gatekeepers, and overcome rejection with charisma and courageSolid organization, multi-tasking, and prioritization skills Strong communication skills, both verbal and written with the ability to engage a senior level audience Strong MS office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) skills are required, and any knowledge of CRM databases (such as Salesforce.com) would be advantageous Knowledge of the financial industry and/or financial divisions/departments a plusCollaborative and supportive. with the right media partners.Effectively liaise/network with a group of relevant media personnel and journalists with the objective of developing and encouraging partnerships between PSW and media seminars including developing agendas, project plans, minute-taking, and production of reportsSupport the development and successful implementation of communications and stakeholder engagement plans, including detailed tactical delivery plansEnsure PSW’s image is protected and promoted in a proper, coordinated, and consistent mannerPlanning and Coordination Work collaboratively with the Communications team, in planning for, organizing, and participating in high quality and result-based events and activities, launching of flagship initiativesPreparation of talking points and speeches for Senior Management, as neededCoordinate for media invitations and attendance at PSW eventsPromotion and maintenance of public information campaigns, packaging, promotion and dissemination of corporate IEC materials for said events, engaging outsourced events organizers and ensuring media follow-up to monitor media coverage, as neededIn consultation with the Communications and Deputy Managers, ensure effective and efficient logistic support to media and press eventsArrange/conduct programs such as speaking engagements, roundtable discussions, press conferences, interviews and conventions, dealing with public relations, advertising companies and production houses as necessary.Conduct advocacy work and prepare communications products for projects, and facilitate projects visits for media as neededTrackingDevelop and maintain a record of all media appearances and prepare and communicate findings in monthly PR reportsMonitor the media, including newspapers, magazines, journals, broadcasts, newswires, social media sites, and blogs, for opportunities for PSWEnsure published content is updated on the PSW websiteQualifications and ExperienceBA/MA degree in Journalism, development/public sector. Title: Data Associate
Description: The Team:Our team governs processes and controls to ensure the highest quality customer master data that is trusted, timely, accurate, and consistent. The team consists of highly trained and motivated professionals on our tools, processes, and workflows who strive to deliver superior client experience and includes overseeing every aspect of the data lifecycle: creating, preparing, using, storing, archiving, and deleting data, in accordance with an organization’s established data governance principles for promoting data quality and integrity. You will closely coordinate with teams such as client buying experience, CRM Operations, Order Management, Fulfillment, Marketing, and Finance teams to ensure effective data governance reporting and analytics. The Impact:Our internal client data is used by stakeholders in Finance, Commercial (Sales and Marketing), OTC and Product management teams for key business decisions so making sure we are providing timely and accurate data that is trusted by our users is critical. The Reporting & Analytics lead would be required to create business opportunities and solve problems through the analysis of large and complex data sets. Moreover, the ability to critically analyze the data using various approaches and tools that helps to transform raw details into meaningful intelligence would play a critical role in solving business problems. Through this opportunity, the individual can provide strategic direction and support in exploring new opportunities through predictive analysis and general insights about the data. What's in it for you: Be a part of an industry leading, Fortune 500 company. Learn, adopt, and implement data governance best practices that impact positively across commercial value stream. Gain wealth of experience by dealing with varied set of stakeholder and business processes. Opportunity to strengthen business processes and implement your innovative ideas. Opportunity to learn and develop professional competencies. Opportunity to work across multiple regions, divisions, experience a diverse and inclusive culture. Responsibilities: Primarily responsible for data correction, cleansing and quality assurance of data collected and processed in salesforce. Serve as a data quality resource and point of contact for managing data issues, doing root cause analysis and proactive data quality checks to ensure accuracy and comprehensiveness. Proactively catalogue and provide mitigation steps for existing quality issues. Use and transform commercial and Finance data to produce descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analyses. Working with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes. Conceive, plan and lead projects in line with department’s current and future strategy. Manage, organize, clean up (LEAN) and improve all existing reports significant to the business. Perform and understand data extraction and analysis from various sources. (Salesforce.com, SQL, etc.) What We’re Looking For: We are looking for a smart professional who possess learning aptitude and growth mindset. A result-oriented individual who take actions to solve business problems, provide analytical insights and interested in learning the overall processes and data quality strategies. A self-starter who enjoys managing their own time and tasks; Ability to communicate and collaborate with colleagues at all levels of the organization. Basic Qualifications: Must have a bachelor’s degree (preferably in the field of Business Management studies, Finance, or Computer sciences). 2 to 3 years of working experience in related field. Knowledge of statistical concepts with ability to do both quantitative and qualitative analysis. Intermediate to advanced Excel knowledge (complex formulas, pivot tables, charting, power tools). Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Proven ability to solve complex problems that require deep data analysis skills. Knowledge of SOQL (salesforce object query language) and data warehouse experience is also preferred. Strong knowledge of large data manipulation skills. Demonstrate investigative research and analytical capabilities necessary to leadership team with accurate and insightful interpretation of financial information. Strong attention to detail and analytical ability with an inquisitive mind. Ability to work independently and as a fully contributing member of a team. Ability to multi-task, work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. Excellent communication skills, both written and oral. Willingness to work in evening/night shift.Flexible Working (optional) We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can. The Location: The role will be located in India, Pakistan, or Philippines. About S&P Global At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep, and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research, and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand industry dynamics, perform valuation, and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies, and governments to make decisions with confidence. Title: Data Associate
Description: The Role: Data Associate The Grade: 08/09Number of positions: 04Location: Islamabad, PakistanThe Team: Our team governs processes and controls to ensure the highest quality customer master data that is trusted, timely, accurate, and consistent. The team consists of highly trained and motivated professionals on our tools, processes, and workflows who strive to deliver superior client experience and includes overseeing every aspect of the data lifecycle: creating, preparing, using, storing, archiving, and deleting data, in accordance with an organization’s established data governance principles for promoting data quality and integrity. You will closely coordinate with teams such as client buying experience, CRM Operations, Order Management, Fulfillment, Marketing, and Finance teams to ensure effective data governance reporting and analytics. The Impact: Our internal client data is used by stakeholders in Finance, Commercial (Sales and Marketing), OTC and Product management teams for key business decisions so making sure we are providing timely and accurate data that is trusted by our users is critical. The Reporting & Analytics lead would be required to create business opportunities and solve problems through the analysis of large and complex data sets. Moreover, the ability to critically analyze the data using various approaches and tools that helps to transform raw details into meaningful intelligence would play a critical role in solving business problems. Through this opportunity, the individual can provide strategic direction and support in exploring new opportunities through predictive analysis and general insights about the data. What's in it for you: Be a part of an industry leading, Fortune 500 company. Learn, adopt, and implement data governance best practices that impact positively across commercial value stream. Gain wealth of experience by dealing with varied set of stakeholder and business processes. Opportunity to strengthen business processes and implement your innovative ideas. Opportunity to learn and develop professional competencies. Opportunity to work across multiple regions, divisions, experience a diverse and inclusive culture. Responsibilities: Primarily responsible for data correction, cleansing and quality assurance of data collected and processed in salesforce. Serve as a data quality resource and point of contact for managing data issues, doing root cause analysis and proactive data quality checks to ensure accuracy and comprehensiveness. Proactively catalogue and provide mitigation steps for existing quality issues. Use and transform commercial and Finance data to produce descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analyses. Working with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes. Conceive, plan and lead projects in line with department’s current and future strategy. Manage, organize, clean up (LEAN) and improve all existing reports significant to the business. Perform and understand data extraction and analysis from various sources. (Salesforce.com, SQL, etc.) What We’re Looking For: We are looking for a smart professional who possess learning aptitude and growth mindset. A result-oriented individual who take actions to solve business problems, provide analytical insights and interested in learning the overall processes and data quality strategies. A self-starter who enjoys managing their own time and tasks; Ability to communicate and collaborate with colleagues at all levels of the organization. Basic Qualifications: Must have a bachelor’s degree (preferably in the field of Business Management studies, Finance, or Computer sciences). 2 to 3 years of working experience in related field. Knowledge of statistical concepts with ability to do both quantitative and qualitative analysis. Intermediate to advanced Excel knowledge (complex formulas, pivot tables, charting, power tools). Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Proven ability to solve complex problems that require deep data analysis skills. Knowledge of SOQL (salesforce object query language) and data warehouse experience is also preferred. Strong knowledge of large data manipulation skills. Demonstrate investigative research and analytical capabilities necessary to leadership team with accurate and insightful interpretation of financial information. Strong attention to detail and analytical ability with an inquisitive mind. Ability to work independently and as a fully contributing member of a team. Ability to multi-task, work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. Excellent communication skills, both written and oral. Willingness to work in evening/night shift.Flexible Working (optional) We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can. Job Grade: 7The Location: The role will be located in India, Pakistan, or Philippines. Title: Application Associate, Financial Modeling
Description: Job DescriptionSegment : Market IntelligenceThe Role: Application Associate The Team:The Financial Modeling & Client Operations teams are primary touchpoints for our clients and are the “face” of the company. Going above and beyond in our service offering is where these teams add value. The Financial Modeling team is a powerful synergy of diverse skills, talents and cultures spread across multiple locations. We are customer-focused and results-oriented providing exposure to a wide array of products, platforms and processes globally. We nurture open and transparent communication, and a great work-life balance, with a positive work culture where team members are recognized for their work. We meet challenges head-on and work for solutions as one team. We work hard and play harder – we participate in cultural and sports events within as well as outside of the company, and also contribute back to the society through the company’s corporate social responsibility efforts.​​What's in it for you?As an Application Associate in Financial Modeling, you will learn, explore, educate and support usage of excel-based products and financial information via customers of capital and commodity markets, where you will hold investigative conversations with clients to drive product usage, retention and revenue. You will leverage your financial market knowledge, your strong customer service skills and exceptional troubleshooting abilities to help the clients with their requests, while showcasing your vast knowledge of our tools, our data and the industries we cover. Many of the Fortune 500 companies in the world will be asking for your help to find solutions to their challenges. You will also be the Client’s advocate and work with different teams inside the organization across many functional areas (Sales, Technology, Content, Industry Research etc.)You will also play a major role in executing and improving BAU proactive processes to prevent issues and improve delivery quality to our clients. In the process you will suggest improvements to the product as well as perform Agile-based User-Acceptance-Testing to curb issues even before they hit our clients.​​Principle Responsibilities:​​Develop financial models in MS Office products for internal/external clients to help them in their routine workflow/analysis.Consistently make proactive suggestions in regards to product usability, presentation, and data quality.Be the primary point of contact for providing critical research and value-adding knowledge to our diverse client base at various financial institutions, corporations, government organizations and universities.Support the client base in their research by responding to their requests which come in via calls, e-mails and other forms of communication. Conduct direct interactions with clients through phone, email and video conferences, as they relate to industry, platform and data questions.What are we looking for?Master’s Degree in Finance, Business or Economics. Candidates pursuing the CFA charter is a plus. Good knowledge and understanding of capital and commodity marketsGood understanding of accounting standards. Strong communication and interpersonal skills.Fluency and eloquence in English is required.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; knowledge of MS Office products and understanding of databases is a plus.VBA Knowledge is a plusExperience with Salesforce or similar CRM applications is a plus.Willingness to work in rotational shifts.Location : Gurgaon Grade : 7About S&P Global Market IntelligenceWe deliver exceptional solutions, for exceptional results.Every day at S&P Global Market Intelligence we collect, scrub, interpret, and analyze vast volumes of content, turning it into actionable intelligence on the global financial markets and the companies and industries that comprise those markets.We deliver the data and insight you need to make informed, smarter business decisions and investment decisions that are critical to your future.-----------------------------------------------------------Equal Opportunity EmployerS&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. Title: UI / UX Designer
Description: We are a UK Based Company, this is work from home full time position from Monday to Friday, Morning Shift.Looking for a dynamic and innovative UI/UX designer who will be responsible for the user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) design of our various digital assets according to the industry trends and engaging social media campaign posters design to achieve the goals. Title: QC Inspector - Electrical
Description: The QC Inspector Electrical is responsible for ensuring that electrical systems, equipment, and installations meet the required quality standards and specifications. This role involves conducting inspections, tests, and audits to identify any non-conformities and ensure compliance with applicable regulations and industry standards. The QC Inspector Electrical works closely with project teams, contractors, and stakeholders to ensure that all electrical work is carried out safely and in accordance with approved plans and specifications.Responsibilities:Inspection and Testing:Conduct inspections of electrical systems, equipment, and installations during various project stages.Perform testing and verification of electrical components, such as wiring, panels, switchgear, transformers, and control systems.Inspect electrical drawings, schematics, and specifications to ensure compliance with applicable codes and standards.Verify proper installation, grounding, and bonding of electrical systems.Compliance and Documentation:Review and interpret electrical codes, regulations, and project specifications to ensure adherence.Document and report any non-conformities, deficiencies, or deviations from approved plans and standards.Prepare detailed inspection reports, including findings, recommendations, and corrective actions required.Maintain accurate records and documentation of all inspections, tests, and audits performed.Collaboration and Communication:Coordinate with project teams, contractors, and stakeholders to schedule inspections and resolve any quality-related issues.Provide guidance and support to contractors regarding compliance with electrical standards and specifications.Communicate inspection findings and recommendations to relevant parties in a clear and concise manner.Participate in project meetings and contribute to the resolution of technical issues and quality concerns.Continuous Improvement:Stay updated with the latest electrical codes, standards, and industry practices.Identify opportunities for process improvement and recommend best practices for quality assurance.Participate in training programs and workshops to enhance knowledge and skills related to electrical inspections.Qualifications:A high school diploma or equivalent; further education or certification in electrical engineering or a related field is preferred.Proven experience as a QC Inspector or a similar role, with a focus on electrical systems and installations.Strong knowledge of electrical codes, regulations, and industry standards (e.g., NEC, IEC).Familiarity with electrical testing equipment and techniques.Excellent attention to detail and ability to identify defects and non-conformities.Effective communication skills to collaborate with project teams, contractors, and stakeholders.Ability to read and interpret electrical drawings, schematics, and specifications.Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to provide practical solutions.Proficiency in using computer software for documentation and reporting.

Employee Engagement:Develop and implement initiatives to enhance employee engagement and foster a positive work culture.Conduct employee surveys and analyze data to identify areas for improvement and action planning.Collaborate with HR and management to design and implement recognition and reward programs.Develop and support employee feedback mechanisms and channels to promote open communication.Project Management of OD Interventions: Lead and manage the end-to-end project management process for OD interventions, ensuring successful planning, execution, and evaluation.Develop project plans, timelines, and budgets, and monitor progress against established objectives.Coordinate and collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to ensure project deliverables are met.Identify and manage project risks, issues, and dependencies, and proactively implement mitigation strategies.Support CHRO in executing Performance Management & Promotion related activitiesAny other task assigned by the CHRO.Skill Set Required: Strong knowledge of talent management practices, D&I principles, change management methodologies, employee engagement strategies, and project management principles.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to collect and analyze data to inform decision-making.Demonstrated project management skills, with the ability to lead and manage multiple projects simultaneously and deliver results on time.Proficiency in using project management tools, data analysis tools, HRIS systems, and other relevant software.Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and develop employees.
Min Experience: 7 Years (Overall experience of atleast 7 years in HR with over 4 years relevant experience in talent management, diversity and inclusion, change management, employee engagement, and project management of OD interventions)

Title: Data Analyst, Transcripts
Description: Job DescriptionThe Role: Working in an extraordinary hybrid team of Scopists and Editors, you will strive to craft transcripts of corporate earnings calls, company conference presentations, shareholder meetings, merger/acquisition announcements and investor days that meets or exceeds our quality and timeliness benchmarks.The Location: This position is based in Islamabad, Pakistan.The Team: You are going to be working with a team that transcribes financial-related conference calls and assist in gathering business information and deliver real-time essential data to clients. You'll be joining a dynamic team of 250+ counterparts in global locations with countless opportunities to learn transferable skills & knowledge.The Impact: Being a part of the team that is constantly evolving, especially with the onset of automated speech recognition software, getting to learn new skills and being cross-trained to different roles (depending upon business requirements) is definitely an exciting opportunity as you will become integrated in a unique team which aims to revolutionize how transcripts are produced and delivered worldwide.What’s in it for you?This opportunity will provide you first-hand knowledge and information on the fast-paced financial world, as you get to listen to earnings calls, investor days and company conference calls live as they are taking place.You will also be provided opportunities to hone your existing as well as learn new skills to contribute more towards the department or company. Using these skills, you may be able to advance your career to a more tech-oriented role or a people management role.You will get to use state-of-the-art speech recognition technologies and cutting edge enterprise-level toolsS&P encourages and assists its employees to explore new opportunities within the company that aligns more with their skill or interest Responsibilities: The primary responsibility of this role essentially lies in building publication-quality transcripts with high speed, multi-speakers and calls involving specialized terminology. In addition to transcriptions, the team will assist in the collection of other Business Information – private company profiles.Each role is dependent on the other and should be coordinated precisely with the other team members in production of outputYou might be required to perform in either the role of a Scopist or Editor using real-time automated speech recognition technology and computer-aided transcription software to produce final output within set guidelinesYou may be asked to proof and/or edit work performed by other Editors or Scopists in order to meet quality control guidelinesYou will be collaborating with peers and Team Leaders to continuously improve the Transcriptions workflow processYou shall be gathering relevant business information as required by S&P Global What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications:A ‘Touch-typist’ with typing speed of 50 words per minute and above (please check your typing speed at and mention in your application/resume)Excellent writing and listening skills in EnglishExcellent hand-eye and auditory coordination along with the ability to multitaskAbility to concentrate, focus and deliver consistently in time in an energizing environmentAt least a Bachelor's/College Degree is preferable (no studies in progress) Preferred Qualifications:Prior experience of working in a Transcriptions team is preferableFamiliarity with financial markets and business organizational vocabulary is an assetGeneral knowledge/know-how of current affairs will definitely help in editing transcripts with context, leading to greater accuracy and precision Work Shift: Primarily a morning shift job, however you will be expected to work in either the evening or evening shift depending on business requirements. It operates through a network of 780+ real-time online branches and 706+ ATMs across the country. The Bank has established a strong foundation while offering premium banking services with major focus on unsurpassed value added services for its customers through advanced solutions.In line with the Bank’s progression strategy, we invite applications from experienced, dedicated and performance-driven professionals for the following position(s) in our Branch Banking Division (Consumer Banking Group). Title: Project Finance Manager
Description: Job TitleSNG II Project Finance ManagerProgrammeEPP/GovernanceJob FunctionClient facingLocationUK/OxfordReports toProject Director SNG II[Soft line reporting to OPM Pakistan Pvt Ltd Finance Manager]Job Level of ManagerICNo of Direct Reports3No of Indirect Reports0Job Description1. Purpose/Key Objectives of the JobWhat is the primary purpose of this job? Describe the 5-6 main objectives of the job and the approximate % of time spent performing each objective.The Sub-National Governance Programme II (SNG II) is a £32 million programme. The SNG II Project Finance Manager will be part of the SNG II management team, working alongside the project management team, specifically the Project Director and Provincial Team Leaders, to implement SNG II within a 5% variance of forecast, and in line with DFID’s requirements as set out in the Terms and Conditions. The Project Finance Manager will also lead on the management of KPI performance tracking. Key elements of the role will be tracking the financial status of the project, support client reporting, invoicing and project financial forecasting.The Project Finance Manager will be responsible for overseeing the project finance team under SNG II, working with the OPM Pakistan Pvt ltd Finance Manager to ensure costs are correctly recorded against account codes, resource codes and deliverable workstreams in order that they can be recovered under the terms of the cost recovery client contract. The Project Finance Manager will develop and maintain client reporting that shows costs incurred and costs expected to be incurred in a timely and value added manner in order that the variance from forecast is minimized as exceeding the allowed variance puts the performance funding at risk.The expected objectives of the role are: Providing reports, estimates and forecasts for client consumption: 30%Providing relevant analysis to the SNG II Management Team: 30%Collecting & analyzing financial data for SNG Management team and Client: 15%Working with and building the capability of project finance and project officers in country: 15%Working with non-finance colleagues in country (information gathering, implementation of senior management decisions, feedback): 10%2. ResponsibilitiesDescribe the responsibilities as clearly as possible. Which tasks is the job holder responsible for and in what way? What results are to be achieved?Acquire excellent understanding of the project’s commercial proposal and sufficient knowledge of the project’s technical focus.Work with project management team and project director to develop value added client reporting that demonstrates performance according to the commercial metrics in the proposal.Provide financial reports as per client requirements, adapting to client needs.Meet the current monthly requirement for resource based forecasting by 25th of the month, consisting of, i) actual costs for previous month, ii) estimate for the current month, iii) forecast for the following month and iv) forecast of invoice values for the following month.Work with project management and technical team leads in country to ensure coding information, the detailed workplan and the days worked is made available to the project officers and project finance officers in a timely manner.Prepares forecasts for project and grant activities in collaboration with team members, including supporting the Programme Manager (PM) with monthly DFID forecastingWorking with the SNG Management Team, maintain and update budget tracking tools for accurately tracking spend to dateReview costs at time of posting to ensure accuracy and minimize recodes.Raise invoices to the client and update backing sheet.Keep tracking of invoices and ensure Pakistan sales tax is properly recorded and deposited in timely manner.Review and approve project budget and provide recommendations to the PD for approval.Tracks monthly project expenditure and report performance against the agreed plan to the team in Pakistan and Oxford.Work with Finance teams in Oxford and in country to support project financial reporting. Work closely with, and provide technical oversight to, the 3 project finance officers in country (line managed by in country finance manager) to support smooth financial delivery.Engage with DFID on a regular basis to support project finance reporting and project oversight. Maintain an effective working relationship with DFID.Supports preparation of detailed activity budgets for projects based on implementation plans in collaboration with the SNG Management team, Team Leads (TLs) and Workstream Leads (WSLs)Ensure compliance with the SNG-II Operations manual, OPM Finance guidelines and regulatory compliance in collaboration with the SNG Management teamConduct regular review of financial aspects of the SNG operating manuals and procedures and suggest changesReview SNG related procurement processes, ensuring full compliance with DFID’s procurement procedures.3. Level of AutonomyWhat decisions may the job holder make without first seeking approval from higher manager/supervisor?The job holder may respond to client requests for financial information with prior approval (and without approval in case of routine information), copying in the SNG Management Team and ensuring client communications are logged in the agreed location.4. ExamplesPlease give two examples of the typical challenges or problems the job holder faces in their daily work and what they must do to overcome them.Communicating implications of cost recovery financial model to client officers in country and agreeing ways of working. Clear understanding of the contractual relationship and of best practice client relationship management will assist in formulating concise presentation of OPM’s interests.Bringing technically oriented in country team leads on board with the increased focus on project planning and financial management implicit in the cost recovery model. Providing swift feedback on the financial implications of proposed workplan developments and variations to support forward planning.5. Job RequirementsEssential educational qualifications, relevant experience and requested skills.Skills and Experience: Proven experience of financial management of UK Government NPAC projects from estimation through reporting against budget and funder audit.Solid understanding of core accounting, period end routines and management reporting.Strong analytical ability and capability to find creative solutions with regard to project financial reporting.Strong financial modelling skills (creation and ownership of financial models).Proven track record of dealing effectively with stakeholders at all levels.Qualifications & Accreditations:Graduate with finance industry professional qualification.At least 06-7 years post-qualification experience acquired in a range of organisations.Excellent IT skills: Excel, Visio, Word, PowerPoint, MS Office 365.
Min Experience: 6 Years (At least 06-7 years post-qualification experience acquired in a range of organisations)

Title: Lead Data Steward
Description: The Role: Lead Data StewardGrade: 10 (Relevant for internal employees only)The Location: Islamabad, PakistanThe Team: The Private Ownership Data Management team delivers research, content, and analytics about private capital markets, including private equity and venture capital firms, their investments, and funds. Our data is used to support deal sourcing, fundraising, data exploration and valuation analysis by investment bankers and private equity professionals. We are providing expertise in private equity data, assisting with client requests, and helping Product and Commercial teams with their engagements with current and prospective customers. Key part of our role is to support development of the new solutions for private capital markets across various data delivery channels (feeds, platforms, etc.), covering both self-sourced data and the data we received from third parties/ vendors.The Impact: This is a senior role in the team: it is highly collaborative and focuses on bringing together various stakeholders to form and successfully execute business strategies through customer-centric projects. The successful candidate will work within the context of a cross-functional team aligned between Data Management, Operations Managers, Product and its support functions and Agile development teams.The role requires excellent project management, data analytics, critical thinking, communication, and stakeholder management skills.What’s in it for you: Private Capital Markets data is in high demand, and our clients value our data driven approach. This is a great opportunity to further develop your data management, critical thinking and technical skills, stakeholder management skills and business acumen. Title: Lightning Protection Inspector
Description: The Lightning Protection Inspector is responsible for conducting inspections and assessments of lightning protection systems to ensure they are installed, maintained, and functioning correctly. This role involves inspecting structures, such as buildings, towers, and facilities, to identify potential risks and vulnerabilities related to lightning strikes. The Lightning Protection Inspector works closely with project teams, contractors, and stakeholders to ensure compliance with applicable codes, standards, and best practices for lightning protection.Responsibilities:Inspection and Assessment:Conduct inspections of structures to assess their vulnerability to lightning strikes.Inspect existing lightning protection systems to ensure compliance with industry standards and specifications.Identify potential risks and deficiencies in the lightning protection system and recommend necessary improvements.Verify the proper installation and grounding of lightning rods, conductors, surge protection devices, and related components.Compliance and Documentation:Review and interpret lightning protection codes, regulations, and project specifications to ensure adherence.Document and report any non-compliance, deficiencies, or deviations from approved plans and standards.Prepare detailed inspection reports, including findings, recommendations, and corrective actions required.Maintain accurate records and documentation of all inspections and assessments performed.Collaboration and Communication:Coordinate with project teams, contractors, and stakeholders to schedule inspections and address any quality-related issues.Provide guidance and support to contractors regarding compliance with lightning protection standards and specifications.Communicate inspection findings and recommendations to relevant parties in a clear and concise manner.Collaborate with engineers and designers to review lightning protection system designs and provide input on installation requirements.Education and Training:Stay updated with the latest lightning protection codes, standards, and industry practices.Participate in training programs and workshops to enhance knowledge and skills related to lightning protection inspections.Provide training and guidance to project teams and contractors on lightning protection best practices.Continuous Improvement:Identify opportunities for process improvement and recommend best practices for lightning protection.Stay informed about advancements in lightning protection technology and industry trends.Assist in the development and improvement of lightning protection inspection procedures and protocols.Qualifications:A high school diploma or equivalent; further education or certification in electrical engineering or a related field is preferred.Proven experience as a Lightning Protection Inspector or a similar role, with a focus on lightning protection systems.Strong knowledge of lightning protection codes, regulations, and industry standards (e.g., NFPA 780, IEC 62305).Familiarity with lightning protection system components, such as lightning rods, conductors, surge protection devices, and grounding systems.Excellent attention to detail and ability to identify defects, vulnerabilities, and non-compliance.Effective communication skills to collaborate with project teams, contractors, and stakeholders.Ability to read and interpret construction drawings and specifications related to lightning protection systems.Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to provide practical solutions.Proficiency in using computer software for documentation and reporting.

Advanced Excel skills. Intermediate to advanced knowledge of HTML, JavaScript and CSS and how they impact search indexing Knowledge and experience working within a CMS-driven website
Location: Islamabad, Faisalabad, Karachi, Lahore, Multan, Rawalpindi, Pakistan

Organization Internal Procurement Procedures and Policy for organization activities at the field level and assist / support on their implementation.Ensure there is proper communication and coordination with the relevant departments regarding procurement and delivery of supplies and all parties are informed of any changes in a timely manner.Ensure the proper elaboration, follow up and works inspection, for contracts on works or services and that they are in line with organization standard policies and procedures for procurement and are of optimum quality standards.Take a pro-active department and anticipate lead times needed for transport and distribution.Ensure the establishment and maintenance of good professional working relationships with suppliers and contractors.Oversee all rehabilitation work being done on health facilities, keeping Islamabad logistics updated on progress / delays. 2: Transport / Vehicles’ & Generators’ maintenance:Oversee the fleet management at field level and ensure the provision of transport services to organization program departments and staff are efficient, sufficient and always secure.Ensure the roadworthiness and safety standards in all active vehicles in the fleet.Ensure all generators are regularly serviced, and all faults are reported to Islamabad immediately.Oversee the fuel consumption of vehicles & generators and comment / alert the Logistics Manager and Project Coordinator whenever normal rates and standards are exceeded.3: Assets & inventory managementSupervise and ensure adherence to organization Assets and Inventory management (control and tracking) system is exercised and assist / support on its implementation.Ensure the tracking system is effective and all assets / inventory items’ documentation available Title: Chief Security Officer
Description: As CSO (Chief Security Officer), you will be responsible for establishing strategic objectives, creating operational plans and delivering programs and services that effectively mitigate the physical risks and threats normally associated with the company (both location ISB and Bagh). We are looking for an innovative leader who embraces new technologies, knows the global corporate security landscape and values service and experience over enforcement and rigidity to enhance MTBC’s overall workplace experience.As CSO you would be directly reporting to GM of the company. Below are the major responsibilities:Create crisis management and contingency plan for business continuity and revise it quarterly.Create a liaison with the local administration like but not limited to Police, District Administration, BOI, Customs, FIA, CAA, Dept. of Health & Dept. of labor to protect company interest.Establish a protocol (SOP) for receiving guests in office and at the Airports.Establish a SOP for CCTV team workflows and incident reporting mechanisms.Secure company assets like but not limited to goods receiving store and inventory store.Establish an SOP for asset movement in and out of the office premises.Establish an SOP for visitors and vendors visiting office premises.Establish SOPs for monthly drills to train employees on their reaction fire, earthquake & terrorist attack.Liaison with Data Security team, understand their needs of physical security of company assets and make a plan to keep them secure.Review the performance of the whole security team once a month and report to GM.Suggest training and courses for the security team to keep updated and agile.Be part of daily management meetings for updates.Follows up on all unusual activities in and around the property and neutralizes risks.Liaison with external Security companies to make sure their appropriately equipped.Weekly travel to Bagh office to check the security needs/condition.

Title: Application Associate, DMS Onboarding
Description: The Role: Application Associate, DMS On-boardingThe Location: Islamabad, Pakistan​The Work shift: Rotational shifts - Following US and EMEA/APAC hours The Team: The Data Management Solutions (DMS) On-Boarding team understands the complexities involved with our datafeed/API products and is responsible for reviewing and facilitating entitlement requests involving our DMS platforms. This entails managing the fulfilment cases created after Sales Opportunities/Quotes are submitted for DMS platforms; reviewing the product components in these Trials/New Sales/Renewals; understanding package relationships, technical dependencies, and licensing requirements; and working with our Fulfillment team to ensure that the client has the correct entitlements. The team is in constant communication with Datafeed Application Specialists (DAS), Relationship Managers (RM), Sales and Product Managers (PM) and will be expected to understand our DMS product and processes.Our team culture is built on proactiveness, business excellence, both independence and interdependence, continuous learning, and improvement, with everyone working towards a common goal to support the Commercial Organization and the company's business overall.The Impact: This team acts as a gatekeeper and ensures that clients receive the correct product and packages for all DMS products. It includes the process from the moment that the fulfilment request is created until the Fulfillment Team adds what is requested by Commercial teams and ultimately by the client. You will be encouraged to raise improvements to the process and update the procedures. By enthusiastically identifying issues with the process, the Associate will help provide excellent support to our internal customers.What’s in it for you:It will provide you with an opportunity to learn and improve your knowledge about our DMS products, processes, and business.You will liaise with different stakeholders and your input will make a difference regarding the overall customer experience.You will have an integral part of the product development cycle and roll out.Responsibilities:You will have exposure to the whole range of DMS product and will be expected to understand end-to-end the operational side of the business, along with each of the products provided.The process involves reviewing Trials/New Sales/Renewals and its product components, approvals, and third-party licenses by confirming the correct product components are added so the client receives the product and data as expected. The job involves keeping the information correctly documented in Salesforce and being able to manage/improve/update the different tools used by the DMS team for the completion of the on boarding of clients. This position requires attention to detail as it involves validation of approvals and third- party licenses by confirming the correct product components are added so the client receives the product and data as expected.You will need to demonstrable evidence of planning and organization skills and can work quickly and accurately in a pressured environment. Ability to remain positive and calm and project a “can do” attitude. The candidate will be in continuous communication with Application Specialists, Relationship Managers, Salesreps and Product Managers Ensure strong lines of communication and working relationships are maintained at all times across the team, stakeholders, process owners, and business partners – developing trust and accountability, and recognizing that a strong working relationship is in the best interest of our customers.What we’re looking for:Basic Qualifications:Have a bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Accounting, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field with 0 to 1 year experienceExcellent English communication and analytical skillsPositive attitude with qualities of a great teammateProblem-solving and thinking out of the boxAbility to adapt and be flexible to changing requirements and proceduresAbility to take ownership and execute tasks independentlyYou must be willing to work in rotational shifts (1- or 2-months rotations) to support the three regions.Preferred Qualifications:Having previous knowledge of our DMS products and/or the data feed businessMS Excel previous experience is highly desirable Experience using Salesforce.comAdvance excel, VBA knowledge or interest, or basic coding interest desirableAbout S&P Global Market Intelligence:At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep, and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research, and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand industry dynamics, perform valuation, and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies, and governments to make decisions with confidence. Title: Senior Technical Project Manager
Description: We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Technical Project Manager to join our dynamic team. As a Technical Project Manager, you will be responsible for leading and managing software development projects from initiation to completion, ensuring timely delivery, quality, and customer satisfaction. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, designers, quality assurance analysts, and stakeholders, to ensure project success. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in software engineering, project management methodologies, and excellent communication and leadership skills. Responsibilities Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects· Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time and within the scope· Developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders· Ensure resource availability and allocation· Manage the full lifecycle of complex software development projects from initiation to closure Develop a detailed project plan to track progress· Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software developers, UX designers, QA engineers, and business stakeholders, to define project requirements and deliverables. Use appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project scope and schedule· Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools, and techniques· Work with other APMs and PMs for the process improvements· Manage the relationship with the client and all stakeholders· Perform risk management to minimize project risks· Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation Requirements: Must have 4 years of bachelor’s degree at least, preferably in the fields of computer science or engineering for technical project managers· At least 6 years of experience as a Technical Project Manager, leading and delivering complex technical projects successfully. Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills· Excellent written and verbal communication skills· Proven knowledge of software Agile development· Strong knowledge of task management tools like (JIRA/Confluence, Trello, GitHub). Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills. Fluent in English to communicate effectively.
Location: Islamabad, Faisalabad, Gujranwala, Lahore, Rawalpindi, Gujrat, Pakistan

Title: Assistant Accountant
Description: We are looking for a talented Assistant Accountant to join our team at Tulip Healthcare, a leading pharmaceutical manufacturing company. As an Assistant Accountant, you will be responsible for supporting the daily financial operations of the company and ensuring the accuracy of financial records.Responsibilities:Assist in the preparation and maintenance of financial records, including general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and payroll.Perform reconciliations of bank and credit card accounts, ensuring that transactions are recorded accurately and timely.Assist in the preparation of financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.Support the Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable functions, ensuring that invoices and payments are processed accurately and timely.Assist with the preparation and submission of various tax returns and regulatory filings.Collaborate with the finance team to improve accounting processes and procedures.Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance.At least 2 years of experience in an accounting or finance role.Strong knowledge of accounting principles and practices.Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel.Strong attention to detail and ability to maintain accuracy in a fast-paced environment.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.In addition, the ideal candidate should be supportive in other tasks as well, including client management and vendor management.The candidate should be able to work collaboratively with other departments to ensure that all tasks are completed efficiently and accurately.If you are looking for an exciting opportunity to join a growing company in the pharmaceutical industry, we encourage you to apply for this position. Tulip Healthcare offers a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as opportunities for growth and development.

Title: Data Associate
Description: The Team:Our team governs processes and controls to ensure the highest quality customer master data that is trusted, timely, accurate, and consistent. The team consists of highly trained and motivated professionals on our tools, processes, and workflows who strive to deliver superior client experience and includes overseeing every aspect of the data lifecycle: creating, preparing, using, storing, archiving, and deleting data, in accordance with an organization’s established data governance principles for promoting data quality and integrity. You will closely coordinate with teams such as client buying experience, CRM Operations, Order Management, Fulfillment, Marketing, and Finance teams to ensure effective data governance reporting and analytics. The Impact:Our internal client data is used by stakeholders in Finance, Commercial (Sales and Marketing), OTC and Product management teams for key business decisions so making sure we are providing timely and accurate data that is trusted by our users is critical. The Reporting & Analytics lead would be required to create business opportunities and solve problems through the analysis of large and complex data sets. Moreover, the ability to critically analyze the data using various approaches and tools that helps to transform raw details into meaningful intelligence would play a critical role in solving business problems. Through this opportunity, the individual can provide strategic direction and support in exploring new opportunities through predictive analysis and general insights about the data. What's in it for you: Be a part of an industry leading, Fortune 500 company. Learn, adopt, and implement data governance best practices that impact positively across commercial value stream. Gain wealth of experience by dealing with varied set of stakeholder and business processes. Opportunity to strengthen business processes and implement your innovative ideas. Opportunity to learn and develop professional competencies. Opportunity to work across multiple regions, divisions, experience a diverse and inclusive culture. Responsibilities: Primarily responsible for data correction, cleansing and quality assurance of data collected and processed in salesforce. Serve as a data quality resource and point of contact for managing data issues, doing root cause analysis and proactive data quality checks to ensure accuracy and comprehensiveness. Proactively catalogue and provide mitigation steps for existing quality issues. Use and transform commercial and Finance data to produce descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analyses. Working with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes. Conceive, plan and lead projects in line with department’s current and future strategy. Manage, organize, clean up (LEAN) and improve all existing reports significant to the business. Perform and understand data extraction and analysis from various sources. (Salesforce.com, SQL, etc.) What We’re Looking For: We are looking for a smart professional who possess learning aptitude and growth mindset.A result-oriented individual who take actions to solve business problems, provide analytical insights and interested in learning the overall processes and data quality strategies.A self-starter who enjoys managing their own time and tasksAbility to communicate and collaborate with colleagues at all levels of the organization. Basic Qualifications: Must have a bachelor’s degree (preferably in the field of Business Management studies, Finance, or Computer sciences). 2 to 3 years of working experience in related field. Knowledge of statistical concepts with ability to do both quantitative and qualitative analysis.Intermediate to advanced Excel knowledge (complex formulas, pivot tables, charting, power tools).Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Proven ability to solve complex problems that require deep data analysis skills. Knowledge of SOQL (salesforce object query language) and data warehouse experience is also preferred. Strong knowledge of large data manipulation skills. Demonstrate investigative research and analytical capabilities necessary to leadership team with accurate and insightful interpretation of financial information. Strong attention to detail and analytical ability with an inquisitive mind. Ability to work independently and as a fully contributing member of a team. Ability to multi-task, work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. Excellent communication skills, both written and oral. Willingness to work in evening/night shift.Flexible Working (optional) We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can. The Location: The role will be located in India, Pakistan, or Philippines. About S&P Global At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep, and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research, and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand industry dynamics, perform valuation, and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies, and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit: S&P Global Market Intelligence S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law. -----------------------------------------------------------Equal Opportunity EmployerS&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Title: ServiceNow ITOM Discovery Engineer
Description: Job Title: ServiceNow ITOM Discovery EngineerAbout the Role: The CMDB Discovery/Service Mapping Engineer is part of the CMDB and Asset Management team. Service mapping/Discovery plays a key role in maintaining critical platforms to enable the IT team to successfully plan changes and manage incidents in the environment along with maintaining an accurate CMDB. The Service mapping/Discovery engineer will gather requirements and implement the service mapping for key services at S&P Global. They will also create/maintain the Service Mapping to ensure its ongoing health through routine health checks as it relates to Service Mapping and all CMDB discovery related functions (troubleshooting, creating & maintaining discovery schedules, pattern remediation).The Team: You will join a small, but dedicated, Config/Discovery team that is responsible to ensure our CMDB/CI’s health metrics are kept current and updated in our ServiceNow CMDB through daily discovery jobs and discovery/MID server configuration best practices. Our CMDB engineer is located on the East coast with the support team located in India. The Discovery Engineer position in the U.S. would add to our India team to help support round the clock discovery remediation efforts to maintain current and accurate data. You will be working with your counterpart in India and heavily involved in daily updates with the team here in the U.S.The Impact: This highly impactful role will contribute to the business by providing the team and divisions accurate information that support ITSM processes and reporting metrics.What’s in it for you: You’ll use your experience and knowledge of ITSM Discovery and Service Mapping in ServiceNow to assist the team maturation and growth in this critical discipline. S&P is embarking on the CSDM journey and automated Service Mapping and this role provides the opportunity to help shape our practice in a highly visible environment as you help implement and support best practices and policies while joining a dedicated and hard-working team. Your efforts will directly contribute to our goal of maturing an area that has executive support with a lot of visibility. Job Responsibilities: Work with process owners to understand the process requirements related to the capture of configuration data and develop technical specifications and solutionsWork with systems managers to ensure that the Discovery tool has the appropriate access and permissions to capture configuration informationCreation of custom discovery patterns as neededDiscovery troubleshooting and pattern remediationProvide visibility to the performance and issues related to DiscoveryCollaborate with Infrastructure Architects to understand IT technology strategy that guide which requirements need to be gatheredWork with Application SMEs to create and validate Service Maps for key applicationsParticipate in Configuration Management meetings and Story Time where appropriatePerform day to day administration of the ServiceNow Service Mapping and Discovery tool, including mapping additional defined business services into the tool as definedMaintain the integrity of the Service Mapping tool across production and non-production environmentsAssisting in troubleshooting patch / release management issues, and upgradesReview the data being populated into the CMDB and act as partial owner of the CMDBJob Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business requiredMinimum of 1 year experience with ServiceNow Discovery and Service MappingMinimum of 5 years working in large scale configuration management databases or related IT organizationExperience working with LDAP, Active Directory and SUDO highly desirableExperience integrating with tools to federate data into a CMDBStrong written and verbal communicationGood interpersonal skills, including collaboration, communication, relationship building, and negotiationProficient with Microsoft Office tools; Excel, PowerPoint, WordIntermediate Windows and Unix administration skillsFamiliarity with network concepts (routers, switches, firewalls, NAT, load balancing)Familiarity with the following concepts: XML, and JSON/script languageFamiliarity with Tanium Ability to discuss credentials, install a product, troubleshoot permission issues, discuss and trouble shoot network connectivity with network engineersAcquaintance with Web and Application Servers, Load Balancers, Databases, and Virtualization (WebSphere, MQ, IIS, Apache, VMware)Summary: The CMDB Discovery/Service Mapping Engineer is part of the CMDB and Asset Management team. Service mapping/Discovery plays a key role in maintaining critical platforms to enable the IT team to successfully plan changes and manage incidents in the environment along with maintaining an accurate CMDB. The Service mapping/Discovery engineer will gather requirements and implement the service mapping for key services at S&P Global. They will also create/maintain the Service Mapping to ensure its ongoing health through routine health checks as it relates to Service Mapping and all CMDB discovery related functions (troubleshooting, creating & maintaining discovery schedules, pattern remediations).Flexible Working (optional)We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can. Return to WorkHave you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative (link to career site page when available), we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.Grade/Level (relevant for internal applicants only): 10The Location(s): India/PakistanAbout Company Statement:S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead. As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape.S&P Global Commodity Insights enables organizations to create long-term, sustainable value with data and insights for a complete view on the global energy and commodities markets.#LI-USA-----------------------------------------------------------Equal Opportunity EmployerS&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. Title: Amazon Pricing Analyst
Description: As an Amazon Pricing Analyst, you will be responsible for monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing pricing strategies for various products sold on the Amazon platform. You will work closely with the pricing team, Team lead, and other stakeholders to develop and implement effective pricing strategies that maximize sales, profitability, and market competitiveness.Key Responsibilities: Pricing Analysis: Conduct comprehensive analysis of product pricing data, Keep Products in Buy Box, market trends, and competitive landscape to identify pricing opportunities and risks. Utilize analytical tools and techniques to evaluate pricing performance and recommend adjustments to drive sales and profitability.Competitive Intelligence: Monitor and analyze competitor pricing strategies, promotions, and market dynamics. Identify pricing gaps and propose competitive pricing strategies to gain market share and maintain a competitive edge.Pricing Strategy Development: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and refine pricing strategies based on market insights, customer behavior, and business goals. Evaluate pricing elasticity and demand curves to optimize pricing decisions.Pricing Optimization: Continuously monitor pricing performance and make data-driven recommendations for pricing adjustments. Implement pricing tests and experiments to measure the impact of pricing changes on sales, conversion rates, and customer behavior.Pricing Compliance: Ensure compliance with pricing policies, guidelines, and legal requirements. Monitor pricing practices across Amazon marketplace to maintain consistency and adherence to company standards. Reporting and Communication: Prepare and present pricing reports, insights, and recommendations to key stakeholders. Communicate pricing strategies, performance, and updates effectively to internal teams and Reporters.Collaboration: Collaborate with Team and Team lead to align pricing strategies with product positioning, promotions, and sales objectives. Provide pricing support and guidance to various teams to optimize business outcomes.Continuous Learning: Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and new pricing methodologies. Leverage emerging technologies and analytical tools to enhance pricing capabilities and drive innovation in pricing strategies.Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree or above in management sciences or any relevant field1-3 years of experience with Amazon Seller Central account Management or Meetoo listings (wholesale).Experience in removing negative reviews by convincing Amazon.Familiar with the Amazon Return policy.Detail-oriented and ability to manage multitasking.Knowledge of Amazon FBA and FBM.Proven experience of Buybox.Exceptional analytical skills.Parks and Benefits:Market competitive salaryInternet and Gym allowanceHome-office set upAnnual Performance AppraisalHealth insuranceLeaves (Medical, Casual, Maternity, and Paternity)Employee development and engagement activitiesNote: Leverify is an equal employment opportunity employer.

excellence.Responsibilities:Manage and lead a team of waiters, hosts/hostesses, and other front of house staff, ensuring they deliver exceptional service to our guests.Create and maintain a positive retention.Implement and enforce restaurant policies and procedures, including safety and hygiene standards, to guarantee a seamless and secure operation.Collaborate with the management team to develop and execute marketing strategies to attract and retain customers.Maintain accurate records of inventory, sales, and employee schedules, and provide regular reports to the management.Conduct regular performance evaluations of staff members, recognizing and rewarding outstanding performance while addressing areas for improvement.Qualifications:Proven experience as a Front of House Manager or in a the ability to handle customer complaints or issues effectively.In-depth knowledge of restaurant operations, including front of house procedures, food safety regulations, and health standards.Outstanding organizational and time management abilities to handle multiple priorities and meet deadlines.Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to make sound decisions under pressure.Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, Urdu, and preferably other local languages.Proficient in using restaurant management software and point-of-sale systems.Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays, as required in the restaurant industry.

Title: International Sales Manager - B2B
Description: We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced International Sales Manager (B2B) to join our dynamic sales team. The International Sales Manager will be responsible for driving sales growth in international markets, managing key accounts, and leading a team of sales professionals. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in B2B sales, a deep understanding of international markets, and excellent leadership skills.Responsibilities:1. Develop and execute strategies to drive sales growth in international markets, including market research, target identification, and market entry plans.2. Manage and expand relationships with key international accounts, identifying opportunities for upselling and cross-selling.3. Lead, motivate, and develop a team of sales professionals, providing guidance, training, and performance feedback.4. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product development, and operations, to ensure alignment and support for international sales initiatives.5. Monitor market trends, competitive landscape, and customer needs in international markets, and provide insights and recommendations for business growth.6. Develop and maintain strong relationships with distributors, agents, and other channel partners in international markets.7. Prepare and deliver sales forecasts, budgets, and reports to senior management, highlighting key performance metrics and areas for improvement.8. Participate in international trade shows, conferences, and other industry events to promote the company's products and services.9. Stay updated with industry trends, regulations, and best practices related to international sales, and share knowledge and expertise with the team.Qualifications:1. Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field.2. Proven track record of success in B2B sales, particularly in international markets.3. Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a sales team.4. In-depth knowledge of international sales strategies and market entry methods.5. Excellent communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with clients and partners from diverse cultural backgrounds.6. Strong analytical and strategic thinking abilities, with the capability to identify market trends and develop effective sales strategies.7. Proficiency in Zoho CRM and other sales management tools.8. Fluency in English is required, and knowledge of additional languages is a plus.Note: It's an onsite & third shift job (6 pm to 3 am)
